Fructuoso y su esposa Lucina tienen 6 hijos y el mayor deseo de ellos es sacarlos adelante y brindarles la oportunidad de que estudien una carrera universitaria, pues la situación en el campo es cada vez más difícil.
texts.en: When he was 16 years old, Fructuoso started working the plot of land that he inherited from his father.  He tried out different varieties of coffee until he was able to harvest an excellent quality export coffee.  Fructuoso is currently 50 years old.  For the last 5 years, all of his coffee production has been organic.  He sends it in to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” (Huatusco Regional Union), an coffee producers union to which Fructuoso belongs.  In his last harvest, he produced 5 tons.  Based on his experience, Fructuoso knows that if he changes out some of his plants, in a span of 3 years he will be producing 8 tons.  To bring this to fruition, he is requesting a loan.  He needs to purchase plants, to work at clearing out his fields and to prepare the soil for planting.  Fructuoso and his wife, Lucina, have 6 children.  Their greatest hope for their children is to help them to get ahead and to offer them the opportunity to study at the university level, as working in the fields just keeps getting more difficult.

loans.use: to purchase coffee plants and to work at clearing his land.

loans.name: Mia Es La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mía es la Victoria está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jesenia inicio hace 5 años con la venta de ropa y con las ganancias y los créditos empezó a vender comida. El crédito lo invertirá en la adquisición de trastes para aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Jesica vende comida, pupusas y sandalias y María Luisa vende ropa usada, bisutería y prendas de oro y plata desde hace 19 años.
texts.en: The group, "Mía es la Victoria" [Victory is Mine] is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women.  One of them is Jesenia, who started her business selling clothing 5 years ago.  With her profits and loans, she started to sell food.  She will invest the loan in the acquisition of utensils to expand her business.  The other members are Jesica, who sells food, pupusas [a thick, filled tortilla] and sandals; and María Luisa, who has sold used clothing, costume jewelry, and gold and silver items for 19 years.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for her business.

loans.name: Mayaqui Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará el ciclo decimo segundo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Germán Busch, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Agustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comerciante de chompas, venta de ropa, ferretería, confección de trajes, taller de cerrajería, plomería, tienda, tejido de fajas, venta de zapatos.

La señora Agustina, indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, mismo que trabaja hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres), mismos que comprará de la las ferias de la Cuidad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de salud y crédito.

En la fotografía no aparese la señora Fermina ya que ella se encuentrava en consultorio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “MAYAQUI SARTASIÑANI” will start its 10th loan cycle at the Germán Busch central office of Pro Mujer.  This group has 10 members, and is headed by a board of directors where Agustina is the president.  The members of this communal bank have a variety of businesses, including: selling sweaters, selling clothing, a metalworking shop, making suits, a locksmith shop, a plumbing business, a store, weaving belts, and selling shoes.  

Agustina states that this is the third year that she has been a member of Pro Mujer; she joined at the invitation of a friend.  She now has a neighborhood store where she has been working for years.

She will use this loan to increase her capital; she will buy food from the markets in the city of El Alto, which she will later sell from her store.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as best she can, because she is married and has 4 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the health education and the loans.

In the photograph, the member Fermina does not appear because she was in a meeting in the office.

loans.use: to buy food

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nidya Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Nidya cliente de nuestra institución inicia su tercer crédito kiva,  casada, madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad de vida independiente. Ella es comerciante se dedica a la elaboración de ropa de bebe para bautizos, los créditos anteriores le ayudaron en gran manera ya que le permitieron  crecer  en su negocio pues lo utilizo para comprar materia prima como tela, hilos y todos los accesorios para sus trajes. Este tercer préstamo al igual lo invertirá en mercadería para su producción como tela, hilos, agujas, encajes, elásticos, entre otros, toda la materia prima necesaria para elaborar los trajes que le encargan las madres que pasan por su negocio admirando su  trabajo. Este crédito le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos porque invertirá en su negocio, sus planes futuros es seguir trabajando con el apoyo de kiva para  mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Nidya is a client of our institution and is beginning her third Kiva loan.  She is married and has two grown children who have independent lives.  She is a businesswoman who works in the creation of baby clothes for baptisms.  Her previous loans helped her in important ways since they allowed her to grow her business since she used them to purchase raw materials such as cloth, thread, needles, laces and elastic, among others -- all the raw materials she needed to create the dresses that the women who passed through her shop admiring her work ordered.  This loan will allow her to increase her income because she will invest in her business.  Her future plans are to continue working with the help of Kiva to improve the level of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as cloth, thread, needles, lace, and elastic, among others.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Buena esperanza  está conformado Lorenza, Erika, Yamileth, Estebana, Antonio, Aracelys, Susana,  Digna Estas emprendedoras tiene herramientas de trabajo diferente pero ha demostrado ser responsable , trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal, lorenza  su actividad económica en una crianza de cerdos en la compra y vende de diferentes tamaño y precios otra de las integrantes del banco Aracely se dedica a una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual  permite sufragar obligaciones y además de proveer lo necesario a su hogar. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de productos de consumo diario como, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente, sal, tiste, hielos, fósforos, entre otros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Buena Esperanza" ["Good Hope"] is made up of Lorenza, Erika, Yamileth, Estebana, Antonio, Aracelys, Susana, and Digna.  These entrepreneurs have different tools of their trade, but have demonstrated that they are responsible and hard-working, with an eagerness to have personal success.

Lorenza's economic activity is raising pigs, which she buys and sells at different sizes and prices.  Aracely, another member of the bank, works in a convenience store located in her home, which allows her to meet her obligations and additionally to provide her household with what they need.  The purpose of her loan is to purchase everyday products such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, salt, ice, and matches among other things.

loans.use: to purchase everyday products such as rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, salt, ice, and matches among other things

loans.name: Mujeres De Agua Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de Agua Viva lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Julia del Carmen quien se dedica al comercio variado que va desde vender recargas de teléfono movistar o claro, ropa, zapatos, frescos, lo cual inicio hace 3 años con unos ahorro, por medio de su arduo trabajo y los créditos ha ido aumentando.
Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de cosméticos, tratamientos…etc. para realizar rifas para el día de las madres.
Las otras integrantes son Grethel quien vende esquimo y un modesto salón de belleza hace 2 años y Jenny de los Ángeles quien vende ropa, bisutería, maquillaje, bolsas, zapatos y cuadernos.
texts.en:
The group, Women of the Water, is made up of three enterprising and hardworking women. One of these women is Julia del Carmen who works at various commercial enterprises. She sells Movistar or Claro telephone credit cards, clothes, shoes and fresh food. She started this business three years ago with her savings from hard work and her investment has been growing.
She will use this loan to buy cosmetics, treatments, etc. in order to stock supplies for Mother’s Day.
The other members of the group are Grethal who sells makeup and has had a small beauty salon for the past two years and Jenny de Los Angeles who sells clothes, jewelry, makeup, purses, shoes and notebooks.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, treatments and other products to sell.

loans.name: Marta Estebana

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica comarca el jicarito departamento de león, la señora Marta se dedica arduamente  a laborar como maestra, actualmente esta desempeñándose como Docente en el colegio de la localidad, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace 23años, es Soltera con 1 hijo al que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrolle.
Una de las necesidades que la señora Marta atraviesa hoy en día es de Mejorar su vivienda, la que se encuentra en mal estado, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de Materiales de construcción como: zinc, Hierro 3/8, Hierro ¼, arena, Piedrín, Cemento, alambre de amarre y mano de obra, para mejoramiento de techo y pared. ya que de esta manera mejorara sus condiciones  y nivel de vida familiar.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the region of Jicarito in the department of León, señora Marta works hard as a teacher.  She is currently working at the local high school.  She has done this work for 23 years.  She is single with one son, to whom she has to provide the necessary conditions so he will develop.

One need that Marta is experiencing today is improving her home, which is in bad shape.  Because of this, she decided to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials like:  zinc, 3/8" and 1/4" iron bars, sand, gravel, cement, wire, and labor to improve her roof and wall.  In this way, she will improve her family's living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like: zinc, 3/8" and 1/4" iron bars, sand, gravel, cement, wire, and labor to improve her wall.

loans.name: En Diosn Confiamos Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal En Dios Confiamos está conformado por Yanira, María Matilde, Agustina de la concepción, Doran María, Brenda de los Angeles,Onan,Luisa, Marlene, María Cecilia, Benita Teodora. Estas emprendedoras tiene herramientas de trabajo diferente pero ha demostrado ser responsable , trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal, Yanira  tiene una pulpería desde hace varios años la cual inicio por la necesitad  de ser independiente económicamente, y asi poder ayudar a su familia   Otra de las integrantes del banco Benita  se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, este negocio le permite sufragar obligaciones y además de proveer lo necesario a su hogar. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, su meta es comprar en mayor volumen mercadería en general que le encargan, para ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos. el motivo del crédito es para la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos, perfumes, colonias, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank En Dios Confiamos ("In God We Trust") is made up of Yanira, María Matilde, Agustina de la Concepción, Doran María, Brenda de los Angeles, Onan, Luisa, Marlene, María Cecilia, and Benita Teodora.  These entrepreneurs have different tools for work but they have proven to be responsible, hard-working, and with the desire for personal success.  

Yanira has had a small store for several years that she started because of her need to be economically independent and thus to help her family.

Another member of the bank, Benita, works in the sale of cosmetics.  This business allows her to pay her obligations and also to purchase necessities for her home.  She has two minor children in her care.  Her goal is to purchase general merchandise that her customers want in greater volume so that she can offer a greater variety of products.  The purpose of the loan is to buy lipstick, creams, treatments, perfumes, and colognes, among other products.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, creams, treatments, perfumes, and colognes, among other products.

loans.name: Modesto Gilberto

texts.es: Modesto Gilberto se dedica a la venta de ofrenda floral. Es una persona muy trabajadora, pues ha mantenido el negocio desde hace más 6 años, siempre les ha brindado a sus clientes un buen servicio. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de mantener su familia es así que han logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante actualmente trabajan de manera independiente. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de corona, flores, canastas, plásticos especiales, alambres, oasis y ramos.
texts.en: Modesto Gilberto sells floral items. She is a hardworking person who has maintained her business for the past six years. She has always provided her customers with great service. She started this business in order to support her family. This is how she can help her children succeed. She works on her own. She will use this loan to buy crowns, flowers, baskets, special plastic items, wire, oasis and sticks.

loans.use: to buy crowns, flowers, baskets, special plastic items, wire, oasis and sticks.

loans.name: Las Elegidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Elegidas lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Mercedes Salvadora quien desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos e invertirá en encargos que tiene para el día de las madres.
Las otras integrantes son Anespajita quien vende lotería y golosinas, Johana tiene una pulpería hace 9 años y Larri quien tiene una pulpería.
texts.en: The group, "Las Elegidas," is made of of four hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Mercedes Salvador, who has made a living selling clothing and cosmetics for 10 years.  She will invest her loan in filling orders that she has for Mother's Day.  The other members are Anespajita, who sells lottery tickets and candy; Johana, who has had a small grocery store for 9 years; and Larri, who has a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy products to fill the orders she has.

loans.name: Claudia Fiorella

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 21 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su pareja y su pequeño hijo de 2 años, ella es una mujer entusiasta, de dicada por completo junto con su pareja a unir esfuerzos para salir adelante; en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y bailar con su pequeño, y en algunas ocasiones engríe a su familia preparando un riquísimo “Seco a la Norteña”, plato preferido por todos.
Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar la carrera de Secretariado que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; actualmente Claudia trabaja en un restaurant atendiendo los pedidos de los clientes, ella trabaja un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, Claudia se encuentra muy a gusto en su trabajo ya que la consideran mucho por su buena atención y trato amable con los demás.
Claudia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un andamio mostrador y vitrinas, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poder realizar la venta de postres en el restaurant donde trabaja; de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos y en poco tiempo desea poder alquilar un local propio donde pueda vender sus postres y así de esta manera en un futuro no muy lejano espera poder tener su casa propia construida totalmente de material noble.
texts.en:
Claudia is 21 years old, lives in the city with her partner, and 2 year old son. She is an enthusiastic woman. She dedicates all her efforts in conjunction with her partner’s to improve their lives. During her free time she likes to listen to music, dance with her son, and occasionally she likes to prepare her family a delicious dish called “Northern Dry.”
Unfortunately, due to lack of funds she was not able to become a secretary which she wanted very much. She still dreams of doing so. At the moment, Claudia works in a restaurant taking customer’s orders. She works about 8 hours a day. She is very comfortable with this job and she is appreciated for her attention to detail and kindness to customers.
Claudia is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since through them she will be able to buy a glass cabinet and display cabinets to sell pastries in their restaurant. This will increase profits and little by little can rent a place to sell her pastries. With the income she then wants to build her own home from scratch.

loans.use: buy glass and display cabinets

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con sus 3 hijos, ella es una mujer perseverante y muy trabajadora que ha luchado siempre por sacar adelante a sus hijos, 2 de ellos gracias al esfuerzo de su madre se encuentran estudiando una carrera universitaria y el menor aun cursa la educación secundaria; María es una madre dedicada por completo a cumplir su gran sueño de lograr que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales y hombres de bien.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias a los ahorros obtenidos de sus trabajos realizados en el campo, desde hace más de un año María puso en marcha su negocio de alquiler de carritos de paseo, el cual fue comprando poco a poco, actualmente cuenta con 8 carritos propios, los cuales están disponibles para su uso, María se encuentra muy a gusto con su negocio, ya que le agradan mucho los niños y desea poder brindarles alegría.
María se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de prendas de vestir para niños y adultos, tales como: pantalones, blusas, chompas, polos, entre otros, los cuales le servirán para abastecer su nuevo negocio de venta de ropa y con ella espera poder incrementar sus ingresos, de esta manera en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder ampliar su negocio de carritos de paseo.
texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Imperial City with her three children. She is a persevering and hardworking woman who is always trying to move ahead along with her two children. Two of her children, thanks to the effort of their mother, are studying a career at the university. The youngest is in secondary school. Maria is a dedicated mother whose greatest dream is for her children to be professionals and good people.
With much industry, enthusiasm and with savings from her work in the countryside, for the past year Maria has been renting little electric cars. She has been buying them little by little. She now owns eight little cars, which are available for use. Maria is very happy with her work. She is grateful for the children and would like to make them happy. 
Maria is very grateful for the loans from KIVA. Thanks to their help, she is able to buy clothing for women and children and adults such as pants, blouses, sweaters, and shirts among other items. With this loan she can supply her new business of clothing sales. With this business she hopes to increase her earnings. In the not so distant future she will be able to increase her little car business.

loans.use: to buy clothing items for adults and children such as pants, blouses, sweaters, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, 42, is married to Simon and they are blessed with two children. She is employed as a lecturer and also raises rabbits to sell. With a monthly income of KES 20,000, she provides for her family’s basic needs. 

Susan has applied for a loan to buy more rabbits and feed and to build a rabbit hutch. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. She hopes to own a rabbit farm and export the rabbits to help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits and feed.

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en: Gorret  is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She has been in business for 10 years selling bananas to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bananas to sell. Besides this banana business, she generates additional income by selling charcoal. Gorret works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to see her business grow so that she would earn enough profits to buy a delivery van and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in her rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 37-year-old business lady and a single mother of one child. She has been selling fruit as a primary business along with making (potato) crisps for the past three years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,500 which she uses to meet her child’s basic needs. 

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Ruth will use the loan to purchase sacks of potatoes. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses she will educate her son. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy dresses, sweaters and blouses for resale. With the additional stock, she earned more profits. She used the extra income from her business to repay her loan and to add to her stock of clothes. She hopes to grow her business in the future.  She has requested another loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy sweaters, dresses and blouses.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (pictured with her young son) is 29 and works for an NGO in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Thim, 30, has full-time employment. They have two sons and two daughters and two of the children are in school. 

Sokha is in the process of renovating the house where she lives. She has applied for a loan of $1,000 to finish the project.  

Sokha’s family lives in a village cross the Mekong River, approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to finish renovating her house.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is a 62-year-old widow living in a rented house. To be able to support herself, she opened a small convenience store as part of the house. She also sells kids' and women's clothes from her home.

Maryam has applied for this loan to bring in more food products for the store. She hopes to increase her revenue so she can move into a bigger place and separate the business from her home.

loans.use: to bring in more food products for the store

loans.name: Veronica Isabel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica departamento de León  la Señora Verónica tiene un negocio como otra alternativa económica desde hace 11 años, también labora en el poblado de Quezalguaque como Responsable Administrativa, con 4años de laborar es soltera, con 3 hijos  a los  que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 

Unas de las necesidades que presenta la señora Verónica hoy en día   es de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en mal estado y en época de invierno se nota más la necesidad antes planteada, es por eso que tomo la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora, por tal razón acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar  un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como Zinc, Alfajillas, Bloques, Cemento, Arena, Hierro y Mano de Obra,  para iniciar la  mejora de la vivienda en la reparación del techo y Pared  para mejor seguridad de la vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindara mejores condiciones a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica, department of Leon, for the last 11 years Mrs.Veronica has been running a business for additional income.  She has also been working as an administrator in the town of Quezalguaque for 4 years.  She is single with 3 children, for whom she has to provide all the necessary support for their development.

One of the needs that Mrs. Veronica currently has is the improvement of the condition of her house. It has been in bad shape and during the winter the need for repair is more apparent.  This is the reason why she has decided to start the repairs.  She has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as corrugated metal, lumber, cement blocks, sand, iron and labor to start the home improvements with the repair of the roof and wall.  This will make the house more secure and this project will bring better living conditions for the children.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as: corrugated metal, lumber, cement blocks, iron and labor to repair the roof and wall.

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es: La Señora María Marlene, tiene 36 años tienen dos  hijos, ambos a su cargo. María esta emprendedora ha demostrado ser capaz y eficiente  se dedica a la  serigrafía, y venta de mercadería en general Su puntualidad, orden y optimismo le ayudó a crecer como mujer independiente, el financiamiento lo necesita para comprar camisas, pantalones, faldas, trajes de baños, bolsos, calzado entre otros. Se siente una mujer realizada por lo que agradece esta oportunidad. Que fundación le ha brindado para poder mantener y salir adelante con su herramienta de trabajo lo cual le da estabilidad a ella y a su familia.
texts.en: María Marlene is 36 years old and has two children whom she supports.  She is entrepreneurial and has proven herself to be capable and efficient.  She is a serigraph printmaker and also sells general merchandise.  Her punctuality, order and optimism helped her to become an independent woman. She needs the loan to buy shirts, pants, skirts, bathing suits, purses and shoes.  She feels like an accomplished woman.  She is thankful for this opportunity that the foundation has provided her to be able to support herself and to move forward with her work, which provides her and her family with stability.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, skirts, bathing suits, purses, and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es: La señora María Esther se dedica a la venta de artesanía hace  6 años, tiene 45 años tiene un hijo a su cargo, maría  ella comerciales y elabora los jarrones, floreros, adornos, mascaras entre otros. Su negocio lo tiene  ubicado en un kiosco donde transitan una gran variedad de clientes y también vende en su casa. El financiamiento es para la compra de barro, pinturas y compra de más artículos.
texts.en: María Esther has been selling crafts for 6 years.  She is 45 years old and has one son whom she supports.  Maria creates and sells pitchers, flower vases and masks, among other items.  Her business is located in a kiosk in an area frequented by a great variety of customers.  She also sells out of her home.  This loan is to purchase clay, paint, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase clay, paint and other items.

loans.name: Maximila

texts.en:
Maximila is married and has a five-year-old child.  She sells clothes to earn a living and has been in this business for more than five years.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business-management skills.  

Maximila hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to add to her stock of clothes.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old, married to Grace, and blessed with two children. He bakes and sells mandazi (snacks made from flour, milk, and eggs and fried in hot oil), a business he started two years ago. He earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

John wants to boost his business and has requested a second loan of 40,000 KES to purchase 5 bales of baking flour, 20 liters of cooking oil, and 10 crates of eggs. The profits earned will be ploughed back into his business. 

John dreams of being a great entrepreneur in his generation.

loans.use: To purchase 5 bales of baking flour, 20 liters of cooking oil, and 10 crates of eggs.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 52 years old, married, and blessed with five children aged 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10, respectively. He owns a garage where he also stocks motor-vehicle spare parts for resale and repairs. He has been in this business for 15 years and earns a monthly income of 18,200 Kenyan shillings (KES). 

Jacob wants to stock his garage and has requested a first loan of 30,000 KES to purchase motor-vehicle spare parts. The anticipated profit will help him buy a gas welding cylinder. Jacob hopes to continue with this business as well as educate his children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase motor-vehicle spare parts for use in his garage.

loans.name: Celia  Magdalena

texts.es: Celia  inicia su segundo crédito  kiva, soltera, originaria de Granada, madre de 2 hijos,  ella es  comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa interior desde hace 3 años, el primer crédito fue de gran ayuda pues mejoro su nivel de vida debido a que invirtió en mercadería en general lo que permitió  el incremento de sus ventas y sus ingresos. El crédito anterior lo utilizo para compra de mercadería en general como ropa interior, calcetines,camisetas, entre otros. Ahora requiere de su segundo crédito para invertir en mercadería  en general pero esta vez en productos alusivos al día de las madres tales como blusas, pantalones, camisones, etc. El cual estima este préstamo le ayudara ya que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su papa, sus planes futuros es  seguir trabajando para salir adelante con su familia y llegar a ser una gran comerciante.
texts.en: Celia is starting her second Kiva loan.  She is single, from the city of Granada, and mother to two children.  She has had a business selling underwear for 3 years.  Her first loan was very helpful because it improved her quality of life.  She was able to invest it in general merchandise which enabled her to grow her sales and her income.  The prior loan was used to purchase general merchandise such as underwear, socks, t-shirts, etc.  She now needs a second loan to purchase general merchandise but this time she will buy items related to Mother's Day such as blouses, pants, nightgowns, etc. She believes this loan will help her because she will increase sales.  Her father helps her with the business.  Her future plans are to continue working to get ahead with her family and become an excellent retailer.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, nightgowns, etc.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorrro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro se dedica a ofrecer productos de medicinas naturales. Tiene más de7 años en su negocio, por lo que sus inicios se dan porque Mercedes necesitaba un medio de ingreso para su hogar y mantener a sus dos hijos. Ella tiene la responsabilidad de trabajar todos los días pues sabe que tiene que llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el tiempo, por lo que tiene que dejar todas las cosas elaboradas en su hogar y salir a vender sus productos. Este crédito que solicita es para la compra de suplementos, polvos, pastillas, vitaminas, hierbas entre otros productos omnilife.
texts.en:
Mercedes del Socorro sells natural medicinal products. She has been in this business for more than seven years. Mercedes started this business because she needed a means of generating income for her household and for supporting her two children. She has the responsibility of working every day because she knows that she must provide for her family's daily needs. One of her greatest challenges is time since she must stop everything she is doing at home in order to go out and sell her products.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplements, powders, pills, vitamins, herbs, and other Omnilife products.

loans.use: to buy supplements, powders, pills, vitamins, herbs, and other Omnilife products.

loans.name: Barrio Grande Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Barrio Grande y está integrado por diecisiete mujeres trabajadoras e indígenas que hablan el idioma mixteco; se dedican a diferentes actividades ecomicas, desean mejorar sus  negocios y sus vidas.
Son Originarias de Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca. En mixteco, Jamiltepec significa “cazando” y en náhuatl “cerro adobe”. Algunas de sus tradiciones son la Semana Santa, el Santisimo Sacramento de la Viren de Guadalupe, del Niño del Catecismo y de la Virgen del Carmen.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Alma Delia de veintiún años de edad, quien se caracteriza por ser una persona callada y amable. Esta felizmente casada  con el señor Roberto con quien tiene dos hijos Ángel David y un bebé recién nacido. Su actividad es la venta de tamales y pan, la cual inició hace seis años. Los tamales que hace son de pollo, marrano, ti chinda y chipiles. Vende en las colonias vecinas de su comunidad y todos los días va de casa en casa. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que le deja buenas ganancias y  cuando le sobran tamales los calienta y los vende en otra ocasión, de manera que no pierde lo que invierte. Alma Delia pidió el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para la elaboración de tamales: chile verde, chile seco, ajo, cebolla, pollo, carne de marrano, hojas de plátano y manteca. Está muy agradecida con Vision Fund ya que con su apoyo y ganancias, su vida y su negocio han mejorado.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Albina - se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Juliana – se dedica a la venta de artesanías.
Martina - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Elvira - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Ana Magali - se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Luz Maria - se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Catalina - se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Belem - se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Flora - se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Avelina - se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Ynocencia – se dedica a la venta de comida.
Maria - se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Iris Isaura - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Francisca - se dedica a la venta de tortillas.
Berenice - se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Jose - se dedica a la venta de pan.
 
Le dan las gracias a la organización por el apoyo que les ha dado a todas las personas con deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
This group is called Barrio Grande (Big Neighborhood) and is formed by 17 hard-working indigenous women who speak the Mixteco language. They work in different economic activities, and they want to improve their businesses and their lives. They are from Santiago Jamiltepec, Oaxaca. In Mixteco, Jamiltepec means "hunting" and in Náhuatl it means "adobe hill." Some of their traditions are the Holy Week, the Holy Sacrament of the Virgin of Guadalupe, the Child of the Catechism, and the Virgin of Carmen.

One of the members of this group is Señora Alma Delia, who is 21 years old. She is known for being a quiet and kind person. She is happily married to Señor Roberto, with whom she has two children, Ángel David and a recently born baby. Her business, which she began six years ago, is selling tamales and bread. The tamales she makes are of chicken, pork, clams, and chipiles (a leafy vegetable). She sells them in the neighborhoods close to her community and goes from house to house every day. What she likes most about her work is that it gives her good earnings, and when there are leftover tamales, she heats them and sells them at another time, so that she doesn't lose what she invests. Alma Delia is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients to prepare tamales: green chiles, dried chiles, garlic, onion, chicken, pork, banana leaves, and lard. She is very thankful to the Vision Fund since with its support and her earnings, her life and business have improved.

The other members of the group are: Albina, who sells tortillas; Juliana, who sells handicrafts; Martina, who sells Mexican snacks; Elvira, who sells Mexican snacks; Ana Magali, who sells chickens; Luz Martina, who sells chickens; Catalina, who sells chickens; Belem, who sells chickens; Flora, who sells perfume; Avelina, who sells footwear; Ynocencia, who sells food; Maria, who sells fruits and vegetables; Iris Isaura, who sells Mexican snacks; Francisca, who sells tortillas; Berenice, who sells Mexican snacks; and José, who sells bread.  They give thanks to the organization for the support that it has given to everyone with the desire to overcome.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tamales.

loans.name: Cirila Victoria

texts.es:
Cirila es una mujer de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, en el distrito de San Andrés con su pequeña hija de 7 años la cual es su razón de vivir, lastimosamente por diversas razones se separo de su esposo, ahora ella es padre y madre para su pequeña hija, ella siempre ha sido una mujer luchadora que ha trabajado desde muy joven, ahora todos sus esfuerzos los dedica únicamente para salir adelante junto con su pequeña. 
Anteriormente Cirila trabajaba en el campo, pero la labor que realizaba era muy duro para ella, en el tiempo que estuvo trabajando pudo reunir el dinero necesario para poner en marcha su negocio de tener una pequeña bodega de venta de abarrotes, actualmente ya tiene poco más de 2 años con su negocio, ella cree que le va bien debido a sus buenos precios, carisma y trato amable.
Cirila se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: azúcar, arroz, aceite, fideos, leche, menestras, gaseosas, etc.; de esta manera podrá abastecer mejor su negocio y con ellos incrementar sus ingresos económicos y con ello poco a poco espera poder terminar de construir su casa y asegurar el futuro y bienestar de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Cirila is a 36 year old woman.  She lives in the city of Pisco, district of San Andres with her small 7 year old daughter who is her reason for living.  Sadly, for various reasons, she has separated from her husband and is now mother and father to her little girl.  She has always been a born fighter working from a young age.  Now all her efforts are focused on getting ahead with her little one.  
She had previously worked in the fields but the work proved to be too hard on her.  During the time that she worked she was able to put together enough money to start a small grocery store business.  She currently has a little more than two years in this business.  She believes that she is doing well because of her good prices, charisma and courtesy.
Cirila is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since due to their help she will be able to purchase merchandise such as sugar, rice, oil, pasta, milk, mixed vegetables, sodas, etc.. This way she will be able to stock her store and increase her income.  Little by little, she hopes to be able to build her house and insure the future and comfort of her little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sugar, rice, oil, pasta, milk, mixed vegetables, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 41 years old and widowed with five children aged 17, 15, 13, 10, and 8. She sells cloth materials, paraffin, and charcoal. She started selling materials seven years ago and earns a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from doing so.

Rosemary is requesting a first loan of 20,000 KES to purchase cloth materials for vitenge (African traditional cloth) for resale. The profit she earns from this business will aid her in repaying her loan and paying for her children's school fees. She dreams of establishing her own business empire.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for vitenge (African traditional cloth) for sale.

loans.name: Roger Danilo

texts.es:
Roger de 30 años de edad es originario de Estelí, casado, de oficio comerciante en el negocio de pulpería, padre de 3 hijos los cuales están a su cargo. El inicio su actividad debido a su anterior trabajo ya que se desempeña en una fábrica y de su liquidación decidió poner su propio negocio a la edad de 29 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a vender mercadería en general la cual daba a sus clientes al crédito pero no le generaba mucha ganancias y decidió retirarse de la actividad, en su actual negocio le apoya su esposa sintiéndose satisfecho con su pulpería pues le va bien ya que no tiene competencia, se encuentra en  una zona muy transitada.
 Solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, etc, todo lo necesario para invertir en su negocio, el cual estima le ayudara ya que podrá ofrecer mas variedades de productos a sus clientes, sus planes futuros son tener su casa propia y crecer en su negocio con el objetivo de salir adelante y vivir cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en:
Roger is 30 years old and originally from Estelí. He is married and the father of three children who are under his care. Roger is a merchant by trade and owns a grocery business. He started this business after he was laid off from his job at a factory. With his severance pay, he decided to start his own business at the age of 29. Roger previously sold general merchandise to his customers on credit, but when he discovered that he was not earning much profit, he decided to quit the business. In his current business, where he has the support of his wife, Roger is pleased that his store is doing well as a result of not having competition and being located in a very busy area.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, and other items that he needs to invest in his business. Roger estimates that the assistance he will receive will allow him to offer a wider variety of products to his customers. His future plans are to have a house of his own and to grow in his business so that he can move forward and live comfortably with his family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soap, and other items.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el rosario los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque fue lo primero que se les ocurrió, esta historia es acerca del señora María, ya que es la representante de este grupo cuenta con 26 años de edad y está casada con el señor Dionisio, quien es campesino tienen 2 hijos quienes estudian primer año de primaria y primer año de preescolar, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes desde hace mas de 3 años.

Dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa e hijo con sus estudios, y así mismo gozar de una mejor solvencia económica y excelente calidad de vida, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas mercancía como son: leche, aceite, huevos, refrescos, focos, jabón, arroz, frijol, etc.
	
Doña María dice que la meta tiene es la de hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que está pensando en ampliar su local, para de esta forma tenerlo bien surtido, con más variedad de productos, y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Da las gracias a FRAC y a los prestatarios de kiva por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, ya que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida, junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Las personas que conforman el grupo de el rosario son las siguientes: Juana, María, melita  y marlen quienes se dedican a la venta de bisutería, abarrotes, alfarería, tienda de ropa y pollería.
texts.en:
This group is called Rosary. The members chose this name because it is the first that came to their mind. This story is about Mrs. María, since she is the representative of this group. She is 26 years old, married to Dionisio, who is a farmer, and has two children: one in the first-year of preschool and the other in the first-year of elementary. She has a grocery store more than three years now.

She started this business to help with household expenditures and pay for her children's education. She also works to have more income and have a good quality of life. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as: milk, oil, eggs, sodas, light bulbs, soap, rice, beans, etc.

Mrs. María’s goal is to grow her business and plans on expanding her locale that way it can be well stocked with a larger variety products and that way can increase profits.

She thanks FRAC and Kiva lenders for the loans, offering her opportunities, and giving her the confidence to believe in herself because she will be able to invest in her business, have a better quality of life with her family, and have a brighter future.

These are the people that make up the group Rosario: Juana, María, Melita and Marlen sell jewely, groceries, pots, clothes, and poultry.

loans.use: buy milk, oil, eggs, sodas, light bulbs, soap, rice, beans, etc

loans.name: Josefa Del Socorrro

texts.es: La señora Josefa es originaria de un  poblado de Larreynaga departamento de león, se desempeña como maestra de primaria con 13 años de laborar impartiendo clases en un colegio de la  Misma localidad, en caso de su núcleo familiar tiene 1 hijo es Casada, La  señora Josefa tiene una necesidad inmediata en su vivienda la que está en mal estado, por eso está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de de materiales de construcción para mejoramiento de techo y pared ya que se encuentran en mal estado. Los materiales que compraría con el financiamiento son: Láminas de Zinc Calibre  12 y 10, Bloques, Cemento, Arena y Mano de Obra, por eso visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr el objetivo , y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida que tanto anhela para su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Josefa is native to the town of Larreynaga, León department. She is an elementary school teacher for 13 years now. She teaches in her area. She has one married son from her nuclear family. Mrs. Josefa needs immediate repair of her home because it is in bad condition. She is requesting a loan to buy materials to fix her roof and wall which are in bad conditions. The materials she will buy with the loan are: sheets of zinc caliber 10 and 12, blocks, cement, sand, and labor. This is why she went to ceprodel to request a loan and finish her project to improve the living conditions for her family

loans.use: sheets of zinc caliber 10 and 12, blocks, cement, sand, and labor.

loans.name: Luis Jean Pierre Jesus

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 20 años, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Imperial con su madre y hermanos, a pesar de su corta edad Luis es un joven muy entusiasta, emprendedor y trabajador; los padres de Luis se separaron cuando él era aun más joven, desde entonces ha contado con el apoyo incondicional de su hermana mayor, quien siempre ha estado a su lado aconsejándolo y ayudándolo en todo lo q necesite; con mucho esmero culminó sus estudios secundarios, actualmente se encuentra estudiando enfermería técnica, ya que le interesa mucho el tema de la atención médica y en el futuro espera poder convertirse en un Doctor.
Gracias a su espíritu emprendedor y al dinero que pudo juntar de trabajos que realizó anteriormente, desde hace 2 años Luis puso en marcha su negocio de tener en su casa una pequeña bodega de venta de abarrotes, adicionalmente desde hace 3 años en horarios de madrugada trabaja en una panadería; Luis realiza todos estos trabajos y a la vez estudia ya que desea poder ganar su propio sustento y ayudar a su familia.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abarrotes, tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, cajas de leche, etc.; de esta manera podrá tener abastecido su negocio a fin de aumentar sus ventas y con ello incrementar sus ingresos económicos para que en un futuro pueda ampliar su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Luis is a 20 year old man who is single.  He lives in the city of Imperial with his mother and siblings.  Despite his young age, he is very enthusiastic, entrepreneurial, and hardworking.  His parents separated when he was younger and since then he has had his older sister's unconditional support.  She has always been at his side to give advice and help him with whatever he needs. He worked very hard to finish secondary school.  He is now studying to be a nursing technician, as he is very interested in medical care and in the future he hopes to become a doctor. 

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and the money he was able to save from prior jobs, two years ago Luis set up his own business selling groceries from a small shop in his home.  He has also worked in a bakery in the early morning hours for the past 3 years.  He holds down these jobs and attends school at the same time because he wants to be able to support himself and help his family. 

Luis is very thankful for the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help he is able to purchase grocery items such as rice, sugar, oil, cartons of milk, etc. to stock his store.  This will increase his sales and his income so that in the future he can expand his grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as rice, sugar, oil, cartons of milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José tiene 43 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos, por lo que siempre ha buscado la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Tiene una gran experiencia, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos por el buen servicio que ofrece. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de perfumes, pantalones, vestidos, trajes, faldas, ropa interior.
texts.en: Maria José is 43 years old.  She sells clothes.  For more than 8 years she has sold her customers a variety of products as a means to generate income for her family.  She has a lot of experience.  The majority of her customers are satisfied with the good service she provides.  The loan she is requesting is to purchase perfumes, pants, dresses, suits, skirts, and underwear.

loans.use: to purchase purfumes, pants, dresses, suits, skirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Cajas Chico.  
Desde hace 26 años se dedica a la venta de comida en el restaurante campestre que ha construido en su misma casa. Su gran habilidad y vocación en la cocina, cautivó a los comensales que cada día acuden a su establecimiento para disfrutar de los diferentes platos típicos de su región. Ella se siente muy feliz, sobre todo porque recibe el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, quienes atienden al público mientras ella prepara los alimentos y cobra. La atención que brinda en su negocio es de todos los días y tienen más trabajo en fechas festivas como el día del trabajador, día de la madre, navidad, etc. Todo este tiempo de experiencia le ha permitido ver la rentabilidad de su negocio para sostenerse económicamente. Su deseo para el futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, además de querer que sea reconocido como uno de los mejores de la localidad. 

Este es su crédito número 11 con MFP. Considera que en todo este tiempo de trabajo con su grupo le ha servido para aprender más sobre el uso del dinero, para invertirlo en el crecimiento de su negocio. Es por ello que es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita.
Alicia invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad, en grandes cantidades, para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Alicia is 48 years old, and lives with her husband and son in their own house located in the community of Cajas Chico.  For 26 years she has worked selling food from the country restaurant that she had built in her house.  Her great skill and vocation in the kitchen has captivated the diners that come every day to her establishment to enjoy the various dishes typical of her region.  She feels very happy, above all because she receives the support of her husband and children, who serve the public while she prepares the food and the bills.  She works in her business every day, and there is more work on festival days such as the day of the worker, Mother's Day, and Christmas.  All of this time and experience has allowed her to see the profitability of her business to sustain her economically.  Her wish for the future is to improve the infrastructure of her business. as well as to be recognized as one of the best in the locality.

This is her 11th loan with MFP.  She believes that all of this work with her group has served as a learning opportunity with regard to the use of money, to invest it in the growth of her business.  She is very responsible with her payments and is grateful to the people who manage the loan she is requesting.  She will invest the money requested to buy basic ingredients, in large quantities, for the preparation of her food dishes.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients, in large quantities, for the preparation of her food dishes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a special shawarma grilling machine

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is married and has three children.  She sells clothes to earn a living and has been in this business for four years.  She also runs a salon to supplement her income.

Winnie has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business-management skills.  She hopes to grow her business further and employ people.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 25 years, single, and supporting her one-year-old child.  She runs a beauty salon, a business she started 6 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 18,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

She is requesting a first loan of 15,000 KES to purchase hair weaves, braids, shampoos, and conditioners. The profit she earns from her business will aid her in educating her child.

Her dream is to see her business grow as well as to educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves, braids, shampoos, and conditioners.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is married and has three children.  She runs a retail shop to earn a living.  She has been in the business for seven years.  She also owns rental houses, which earn her extra income.  She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. She hopes to grow her business and employ people.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, sweets and soda.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, sweets and soda

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is a 31-year-old businessman who is married to Teresia, a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with two children who are nine and two years old.  He has been running an electronic outlet shop for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Shadrack will use the loan to purchase more stock of electronics for his shop. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. 

He hopes to boost his business, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of electronics for his shop.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with two children who attend school. She is a resident of Kisauni, Kenya. For the past 10 years, Margaret has been selling fried fish to her neighbors and passersby. Margaret was introduced to Yehu by her friends. Her main business challenges are inflation and price fluctuations.

Margaret is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She currently sells at the market and her ambition is to build a permanent business premise. Margaret believes the income from her loan will help improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 43 years old, is married and supports a family of six members.

Four years ago, Mohammad opened a small convenience store. During these four years, he added more shelves and bought a fridge for drinks. 

Now Mohammad has applied for this loan to add more food products so he can serve more customers.

loans.use: to purchase more food products for his store

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 37-year-old business lady married to Eric who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with three children who are 19, 15 and 12 years old. She has been running a retail outlet for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Grace will use the loan to restock her business with handkerchiefs, watches, pegs and towels. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will save towards the education of her children. 

In the future, she hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To restock her business with handkerchiefs, watches, pegs and towels

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 52 years old and a mixed crop farmer who is single and a mother of four adult children. She has been in a farming business for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lucy will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.  With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her last-born child since the others have completed their education. 

She hopes to open a retail shop, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 50-year-old business lady and married to Joseph who is employed. They are blessed with three adult children. She has been running a medical clinic for the past 15 years with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Ann will use the loan to purchase a piece of land for future use. With the anticipated profit from the clinic business, she will educate her children. 

She hopes to build rental houses and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy carrot and corn seeds and natural fertilizers to sprinkle on his crops when they are mature

loans.name: Klaratsetkin

texts.ru: Кларацеткин 58 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. Кларацеткин в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  10 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый  с суммы 5,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Кларацеткин, на сегодня насчитывает 3 коровы,  2 головы коз и приносит доход около 5,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Кларацеткин обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку 12 голов ягнят.  Доходы от кредита  Кларацеткин планирует вложить в постройку навеса над стойлом для скота.
texts.en: Klaratsetkin is 58 years old, married and a mother of three children.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry ten years ago.  Thanks to Klaratsetkin's hard works and persistence, the business, started with a sum of 5,000 som, today contains three cows and two goats, and yields an income of about 5,000 som per month.  In order to further develop her business, Klaratsetkin requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy 12 lambs.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building an awning over the livestock stall.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мире 58 лет. Мира в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  5 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый  с суммы 3,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Миры, на сегодня насчитывает 2 коровы,  15 голов овец и приносит доход около 5,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Мира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита  Мира планирует вложить в постройку нового сарая для скота.
texts.en: Mira is 58 years old.  To provide a primary source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry five years ago.  Thanks to Mira's hard works and persistence, the business, started with a sum of 3,000 som, today contains two cows and 15 sheep, and yields an income of about 5,000 som per month from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Mira requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a new barn for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Mirzomiddin

texts.ru: Мирзомиддин проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 32 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Мирзомиддин занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en:
Mirzomiddin lives in the Dangara region. He is 32 ​​years old, married, and has three children. 

He works in animal husbandry and raises cattle at home. He has been involved in this activity for five years.  

He is taking a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es:
Jacinta tiene 62 años, es una mujer muy valiente, pues enviudó hace 3 años, de Oscar su esposo. Tuvieron ocho hijos, a los que cuidaron con amor. Ahora ella vive en casa de su hija Sara.   
Jacinta se siente sola, pues su eterno compañero, murió. A raíz de ello comenzó a vivir con su hija, a la que quiere mucho. Pero como es una mujer trabajadora, continua ganándose la vida como cocinera en una mina, donde prepara 30 platos de comida casera. Le va muy bien en su negocio, pues la comida por esa zona es escasa y le brinda mayor demanda. Además, gracias a su dedicación pudo ser contratada como cocinera en el cafetín de la mina, ahí le pagan 25 soles diarios. Todas estás actividades, más la pensión mensual que recibe por la muerte de su esposo, hacen que tenga una estabilidad económica. Eso la llena de tranquilidad y alegría, “esperaré en paz, pues el resto que me quede de vida, no preocuparé a mi familia”, comenta tranquila.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su grupo, porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Jacinta invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de víveres, trucha (pescado) y cuyes (tipo conejo) para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 62, is a very courageous woman because she was widowed three years ago, from her husband Oscar.  They had eight children for whom they cared lovingly.  Now she lives in her daughter Sara's house.

Jacinta feels alone because her eternal companion died.  Because of this she began to live with her daughter, whom she loves a lot.  But because she is a hardworking woman, she continues earning a living as a cook in a mine, where she makes 30 dishes of homemade food.  It is going very well for her in her business because food in that area is scarce and this gives her greater demand.

In addition, thanks to her dedication she managed to be hired as a cook in the cafe of the mine where they pay her 25 soles [PEN] a day.  All these jobs, plus the monthly pension she receives for the death of her husband, give her financial stability.  This fills her with peace and happiness.  "I will wait in peace, because the rest of my life I will not worry my family," she says calmly.

This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to make the payments on time.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her group because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Jacinta will invest the requested money in buying provisions, trout (fish), and guinea pigs (the rabbit type) to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy provisions, trout, and guinea pigs to prepare food.

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло трудолюбивый и добрый молодой парень, ему 22 года.  Более 2-х лет он занимается предоставлением национальной кухни. Имеет столовую в центре города, там работают его мать и отец и они все усердно работают ради улучшения благосостояния своей семьи. В столовой продает разные виды напитков. Сунатулло запрашивает займ для покупки продовольственных товаров для своей столовой. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Sunatullo is a hardworking and kind young man; he is 22 years old.  He has been involved in providing a national cuisine for over two years.  He has a cafe in the city center, where his mother and father work, and all of them work hard in order to improve the welfare of their family.  He sells various types of beverages at the cafe.  Sunatullo is requesting this loan to buy food products for his cafe.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Фаридун заботливый семьянин, на воспитании имеет двоих детей, сыну 5 лет, а дочке  годик. Жена воспитывает детей, а Фарудун работает, чтобы содержать их в хороших условиях жизни. Более 10 лет Фаридун занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, так как из пшеницы получает муку, а также использует для семейных нужд. Фаридун запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, семян и горюче-смазочных материалов.
texts.en:
Faridun is a caring family man and the father of two children; he has a 5-year-old son and a daughter who is just one year old.  While his wife takes care of the children, Faridun works to provide good living conditions for his family.

Faridun has been involved in agriculture for more than 10 years.  He mostly grows wheat, from which he gets flour, and keeps some of his production for his family's needs.

He is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel and lubricants.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel and lubricants.

loans.name: Rower Kenyo

texts.es:
Rower es un joven de 20 años, viven en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pareja y su pequeña niña de 2 meses de nacido; a pesar de su corta edad, Rower es muy entusiasta y trabajador, él se encuentra muy feliz por el nacimiento de su bebé, a quien piensa dedicarle su mayor esfuerzo para que no le falte nada, en sus ratos libre le gusta ver programas educativos y en algunas ocasiones le gusta preparar su plato favorito como es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo” a fin de pasar gratos momentos con su familia. 
Con mucho esmero Rower culminó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Administración de Empresas que tanto quería, pero sueña con poder hacerlo algún día; gracias a su deseo de sacar adelante a su familia, Rower trabaja como obrero en una empresa de construcción de la ciudad, él dedica a su trabajo un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se encuentra a gusto en su trabajo ya que lo consideran mucho por su trato amable y buena labor. 
Rower agradece la ayuda brindada por los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá realizar los acabados que requiere el cuarto que ocupa con su familia, estos acabados son: pintado, ventanas, puesta de piso y otros; de esta manera poco a poco y gracias a su trabajo espera poder comprar un terreno para construir su casa propia y así brindar mayor comodidad y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, en especial para su pequeña niña.
texts.en:
Rower is a young man, 20 years old, who lives in the city of Ica in Santiago district, along with his partner and their young daughter who was born two months ago. Despite his young age, Rower is very enthusiastic and hard-working. He is very happy about the birth of his baby, and he plans to dedicate his greatest effort to make sure she doesn't lack anything. In his free time, he likes to watch educational programs and sometimes he enjoys preparing his favorite dish, the rich "Arroz con Pollo" [rice and chicken], and spending pleasant moments with his family.

With great care, Rower finished his secondary studies. Unfortunately, for economic reasons he could not go on to study Business Administration like he wanted to, but he dreams of doing so one day. Thanks to his desire to get his family ahead, Rower works at a construction business in the city. He works approximately ten hours a day and is well liked at his job for his friendliness and good work.

Rower is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders are offering him. Thanks to their support, he will be able to complete the finishing touches needed on the room where he and his family live. These finishing touches are: painting, windows, flooring, and others. This way, little by little and thanks to his work, he hopes to be able to buy a plot of land to build his own house so he can offer greater comfort and a better quality of life to his family, especially his little girl.

loans.use: to put the finishing touches on the room where he and his family live

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.ru: Гулнаре 47 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей . Гулнара в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  5 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый  с суммы 15,000 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Гулнары, на сегодня насчитывает 2 коровы,  2 лошади, 10 голов овец и приносит доход около 7,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также, Гулнара обрабатывает 0,66 га земли, где выращивает многолетние травы и картофель.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Гулнара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита  Гулнара планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulnara is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children. Gulnara began to engage in animal husbandry five years ago as the main source of income for her family. Starting with the sum of 15,000 soms, Gulnara through hard work and perseverance in her business now has two cows, two horses, ten sheep and monthly revenue of about 7,000 soms from the sale of dairy and meat products. Also, Gulnara handles 0.66 hectares of land where she grows cereal grasses and potatoes. 

In order to further develop her business, Gulnara appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 90,000 soms to purchase livestock -- calves. Gulnara plans to invest income for credit in further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина заботливая и добросовестная жена. Её муж является рабочим. Более 5 лет она занимается выращиванием и продажей сельхозпродуктов. Взяла в аренду участок земли и в основном хочет посеять пшеницу, рис и кукурузу. В бизнесе помогает  свекровь. Зарина полученный урожай продает на местном рынке, а также часть урожая использует для питания семьи. Зарина хотела бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений, семян, горюче-смазочных материалов и оплаты труда работников. Она надеется, что вы поддержите её и заранее благодарна вам.
texts.en: Zarina is a careful and conscientious woman. Her husband is a laborer. For more than five years, she has been engaged in the cultivation and sale of agricultural products. She leased land and basically wants to grow wheat, rice, and corn. Her mother-in-law helps her in the business. Zarina sells her harvest at the local market and uses part of the crop also to feed the family. Zarina wanted to receive a loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, fuel and lubricants, and money to pay farmhands. She hopes that you will support her and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Izzatoy

texts.ru: Иззатой 55 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей . Иззатой в качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи,  29 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый  с суммы 1,500 сом бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости  Иззатой, на сегодня насчитывает 2 коровы,  2 головы бычков и приносит доход около 8,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Иззатой обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита  Иззатой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Izzatoy is a 55-year-old widow and the mother of four children. She began to engage in animal husbandry 29 years ago as the main source of income for her family. Starting with the sum of 1,500 soms, through hard work and perseverance she now has two cows, two bulls and monthly revenue about 8,000 soms from the sale of dairy products. With the goal of further developing her business, Izzatoy appealed to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan in the sum of 20,000 soms to buy livestock - calves.  She plans to invest income from the loan to further her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали женат и на воспитании имеет  одного несовершеннолетнего ребенка. Муродали старается содержать свою семью в хороших условиях и жена также помогает ему в содержании семьи, предоставляя услуги швеи. Она шьет национальные платья и принимает заказы. Муродали более 6 лет занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания на центральном местного рынка. Имеет широкий ассортимент продуктов и много постоянных клиентов. Муродали хотел бы получить займ для покупки продуктов питания с целью пополнения товарооборота
texts.en:
Murodali is married and raising one child who is still a minor.  He works hard to provide a good quality of life for his family.  

His wife helps him to provide for the family: she works as a seamstress and receives orders to sew traditional Tajik dresses. 

Murodali himself has been buying and selling food products at the local central market for more than 6 years.  He sells a wide selection of products and has many regular customers.

He would like to receive a loan to buy food products in order to increase his inventory turnover.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: La Estrella De Luz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Estrella Azul lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Marcela quien vende ropa desde 7 años en Matagalpa. Ella invertirá en mercadería para subir  el negocio principalmente pantalones, camisas y vestido.
Los otros integrantes Marina  quien vende refrescos y comida desde hace 5 años y Wiliam José venta de pollo desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The group Estrella Azul is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Marcela, who has been selling clothing in Matagalpa for seven years. She will invest in merchandise—mainly pants, shirts, and dresses—to improve her business.

The other members are Marina, who has been selling refreshments and food for five years, and William José, who has been selling chicken for six years.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.es:
Pamela tiene 21 años, es una mujer joven y muy trabajadora. Vive junto a sus padres (Javier y Sara) y sus tres hermanos.
A su corta edad comenzó a trabajar para solventar sus estudios de psicología en una universidad privada, pues su mayor deseo es convertirse en profesional. De esa manera, desde hace algunos años, comenzó en el negocio de los fotocopiados. Todas las tardes trabaja sin descanso, pues en las mañanas son sus clases. Según cuenta, los fines de semana, son los días donde ella vende en mayor cantidad, pues su negocio se ubica cerca de un colegio y a una dependencia policial, quienes cada fin de semana hacen sus reportes, informes, etc., por lo que solicitan el servicio de fotocopiado, por lo que a veces tiene que faltar a sus clases. Pero eso no es una desventaja para ella, porque estudia constantemente, ya que desea culminar sus estudios con honores.

Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además, le agrada ser parte de su grupo, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias.
Pamela invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de tinta y millares de papel para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Pamela is 21 years old and a very hardworking young woman. She lives with her parents, Javier and Sara, and her three siblings.

At a young age, she began working to pay for her psychology studies at a private university; her greatest wish is to become a professional. To that end, a few years ago, she began her photocopying business. She works nonstop every afternoon, as she has her classes in the mornings. She explains that she sells the most on weekends, as her business is located near a school and a police station; they do their paperwork every weekend, requiring photocopying services, for which she sometimes has to miss her classes. But this is not a drawback for her because she studies constantly, given that she wants to finish her studies with honors.

This is her second loan with MFP, which she hopes will make her plans a reality. For her part, she promises to fulfill her commitment to make her loan payments. In addition, she is pleased to be part of her group, because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.

loans.use: to purchase ink and thousands of sheets of paper to supply her photocopying business.

loans.name: Carla Pastora

texts.es:
En el municipio de Larreynaga departamento de León, La señora Carla se Desempeña como maestro de primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 9 años, es Madre Soltera  con 1 hijo a su cargo,  a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
