Con una visión emprendedora, ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio ya que necesita comprar  algunos productos necesarios para la pesca tales como: redes, flotadores, plomo lazos, etc. Tiene mucha confianza que de esta forma su situación económica mejorará y podrá continuar llevando el pan de cada día a su  hogar.
texts.en:
Edgardo Balmore is 28 years old and lives with his family, which is composed of his wife and two children. Edgardo has worked in fishing for 13 years. Thanks to this activity, he has managed to make the money necessary to meet his family's basic needs. 

While he fishes, his wife sells the seafood that they offer for sale day in and day out. Both work for a better future for their children; they dream of giving them a better quality of life that might allow their children access to better conditions than they have had. 

With an enterprising vision, Edgardo made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business; he needs to buy some equipment necessary for fishing, like nets, floats, lead sinkers, leaders, etc. He has a great deal of confidence that in this way, his economic situation will improve and he will be able to continue bringing home bread every day.

loans.use: to purchase nets, floats, lead sinkers, leaders, etc.

loans.name: Bernadetta

texts.en:
Bernadette is 64 years old, a business lady, and a single mother of two adult children. She has been running a medical clinic for the past 10 years with the monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to purchase a piece of land for future use. With the anticipated profit from the clinic business she will educate her children up to university level.  

She hopes to build rental houses and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of land.

loans.name: C 8084 Coabunya V Group

texts.en: Fabien is 46 years old, married and the father of three children who also cares for seven other relatives. He earns a living by selling various goods, including coffee, potatoes and tomatoes. Fabien leads a loan group called "C 8084 COABUNYA V" in the local language. In this photo, he's the one who is holding a piece of paper. He has been in his current line of work for two years, and works from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily except on weekends. Fabien currently employs five people in his business and is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy various items to sell, including more coffee, potatoes and tomatoes. He will use his profits to save for the future, pay school fees for his children and re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various food items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Stellamarys

texts.en:
Stellamarys is a 24-year-old business lady and a single mother of a three-year-old child. She has been running a retail shop for the past year with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Stella will use the loan to purchase more inventory like sugar, rice, and maize meal for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase inventory like sugar, rice, and maize meal.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 58 years old, married to Joseph who is a farmer and helps in providing for the family. They are blessed with four children whose ages are between 15 and 30 years. Christine runs a cereals business whereby she buys and sells maize, which earns her a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

Christine is servicing her second loan of 20,000 KES with KADET LTD, after successfully servicing her first loan. She will use this loan to purchase dry maize for resale.

She will use the anticipated profits from the cereals business to add more dry maize for resale. Her hope and dream is to be able to provide her kids with quality educations.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize for resale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 27 años, su pareja es Yuvan con quien tiene un hijo de 4 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Chanchamayo.
Gracias a su perseverancia puede asegurar a su familia el sustento necesario. Se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, para ello debe llegar hasta los sembríos de los mismos productores para adquirir la mercadería a precios módicos. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y afirma que le va bien. “A veces bajan los precios pero siempre se vende un producto más que el otro, por ejemplo estos meses me conviene vender paltas”, menciona. Además afirma que es rentable la venta de tanyarinas, mandarinas, papayas y paltas. Sus ventas dependen de cómo organice su tiempo y se sitúe en lugares estratégicos. Por eso, los viernes expende su mercadería cerca del hospital estatal, por la afluencia de personas; los sábados y domingos se ubica en el óvalo de la ciudad; y los lunes en un puente de una zona de ferias. De esta manera puede estar segura que sus ventas son exitosas. Ella desea afianzar su negocio y aumentar el volumen de ventas.

Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por eso agradece el apoyo y la oportunidad. Es la primera vez que se agrupa con mujeres que comparten los mismos intereses, todas ella forman el banco comunal “Los Amigos Capelinos”.
Con el dinero que ahora solicita podrá adquirir frutas como naranjas, paltas, mandarinas y otras al por mayor, para ofrecerlas en sus puestos de ventas.
texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old; she and her husband Yuvan have a four-year old son. They live in their own house located in the Chanchamayo district.

Thanks to her perseverance Judith ensures that her family have the basic essentials. She earns her living buying and selling fruit and visits the fruit growers themselves in order to obtain reasonable prices. She’s been doing this work for two years and says all is going well. “Sometimes prices are low but you always sell more of one product than another,” she says. “For example at this time of year avocados sell well.” She adds that tangerines, mandarins, papayas, and avocados are profitable fruit. Sales depend on how she organizes her time and whether she finds a strategic location. On Fridays, for example, she sets up near the state hospital as it’s always busy there. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes to the town’s traffic circle. And on Mondays the best place is a bridge in the market area. In this way Judith ensures that she makes lots of sales. She wishes to put her business on a more sound footing and increase sales.

This will be her first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support and opportunity. It is also the first time she has joined with a group of women who share the same interests. The group is called Los Amigos Capelinos Community Bank. With the loan money Judith will buy oranges, avocados, mandarins etc. at wholesale prices to sell at her stalls.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 49 years old, a businesswoman and the single mother of two children. She has been running a retail shop for the past four years with a monthly income of KES. 5,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staffer. Esther will use the loan to purchase stock including sugar, rice, flour, detergents and soft drinks for her retail shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale shop which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 38-year-old married woman who is blessed with six children who are between the ages of 8 and 18 years old. Irene supports her six children with the help of her spouse, Chumo, who is a small scale farmer. 

Irene runs a second-hand clothing business in Marigat town that has been in operationfor the last 5 years, and that she generates a monthly income of 50,000 KES from this business. 
    
Having successfully repaid her previous loans, Irene is now seeking a fourth loan in the amount of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. With the loan proceeds, she intends to use 20,000 KES to purchase second-hand clothes for re-sale, and the remaining funds she will use to meet other overhead costs such as transportation costs, business license renewal costs, and rent.  With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she would like to expand the business and better meet the needs of her family.

She would also like buy a plot of land on which she could build a residential house. Her dream is to be able to grow her business and to be able to meet her family's financial needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for re-sale purposes and to cover various overhead costs

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva de 44 años vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo,  3 hijos: Karla, Alba y Manfredi, los primeros  dos estudian en la Universidad y el último de 16 años estudia el bachillerato, sus hijos también colaboran con la atención del negocio. Ellos son por quienes Rosalva día a día lucha para salir adelante y trabaja duro. Es una persona luchadora que con esfuerzo quiere impulsar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales que cuenten con mejores oportunidades de vida. Actualmente posee una tienda donde vende productos  de primera necesidad como huevos, aceite, manteca, entre otros; su esposo también posee un negocio en el que lava carros. Constituyen una pareja muy responsable y trabajadora. La tienda de Rosalva esta ubicada en su misma casa y desea ampliarla, es decir,  vender otras cosas como ropa, zapatos y otros productos con los que aún no cuenta y demandan sus clientes, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para comprar ropa de caballero y señorita, y así también con articulos de primera necesidad como aceite, leche, huevos y frijoles. Está segura que con las ganancias obtenidas ella logrará cancelar el préstamo a tiempo y dar a su familia una mejor vida
texts.en:
Rosalva is 44 years old and lives with her family, made up of her husband and three children, Karla, Alba, and Manfredi.  The first two study in the university and the last, a 16 year old, is in high school.  Her children also help out by attending to the business.  They are the ones for whom Rosalva fights and works hard day after day to try to get ahead.  She is a determined person, and through her efforts wants to propel her children to be professionals so that they have greater opportunities in life.  Currently she has a store where she sells basic goods like eggs, oil, and cooking grease, among other items.  Her husband also has a car wash business.  Together they are a very responsible, hard-working pair.  Rosalva's store is located within her own home. She would like to expand it, meaning sell things like clothes, shoes, and other products she doesn't currently have which her clients ask for.  For this reason, she is requesting this loan through INTEGRAL; to buy both men's and women's clothes, as well as more basic food goods like oil, milk, eggs, and beans.  She is sure that with the earnings gained she will be able to pay back the loan on time and give her family a better life.

Rosalva de 44 años vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposo,  3 hijos: Karla, Alba y Manfredi, los primeros  dos estudian en la Universidad y el último de 16 años estudia el bachillerato, sus hijos también colaboran con la atención del negocio. Ellos son por quienes Rosalva día a día lucha para salir adelante y trabaja duro. Es una persona luchadora que con esfuerzo quiere impulsar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales que cuenten con mejores oportunidades de vida. Actualmente posee una tienda donde vende productos  de primera necesidad como huevos, aceite, manteca, entre otros; su esposo también posee un negocio en el que lava carros. Constituyen una pareja muy responsable y trabajadora. La tienda de Rosalva esta ubicada en su misma casa y desea ampliarla, es decir,  vender otras cosas como ropa, zapatos y otros productos con los que aún no cuenta y demandan sus clientes, es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito para comprar ropa de caballero y señorita, y así también con articulos de primera necesidad como aceite, leche, huevos y frijoles. Está segura que con las ganancias obtenidas ella logrará cancelar el préstamo a tiempo y dar a su familia una mejor vida

loans.use: to buy clothes for both gentlemen and ladies, as well as basic goods such as oil, milk, eggs, and beans

loans.name: C 2256 Abadacogora Group

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with five children ranging in age from two to twelve. She sells food and drinks including bread, milk and Fanta and has been working in this field for four years.  She is the leader of the C 2256 ABADACOGORA group and is the one in the photo with a piece of paper in her hand. Josephine works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day of the week and currently employs three people to help her.

Josephine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her canteen business by buying more food and drinks including break, milk and Fanta for resale. This loan will allow her to save for her future and to be able to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to expand her canteen business by buying more food and drinks including bread, milk and Fanta for resale.

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en: Helena is in her late 40s, married and the mother of four children, two of whom are grown while the other two are still in school. She earns a living by running several businesses, including selling bricks, food and water from big trucks. She has been in business since 2005, works from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and earns a very good monthly profit. She is requesting her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to start her business, pay school fees, buy a plot of land, built a small house, and buy a TV set. She has repaid all of her loans successfully, and plans to use this new one to buy more bricks to resell, increase the amount of food she has to sell and pay school fees. Her dream is to one day be able to build another house. She will share this loan with her group, "Mbinga," which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back this loan.

loans.use: to buy more bricks and food items to sell and pay school fees.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. Her husband is a farmer. Julita is able to help provide for her family through selling tuba (coconut wine). She earns 450 PHP per day with this business. Julita also helps her husband grow rice crops on their land. She does her best to take care of her family and provide for their basic necessities.

Julita has requested a loan to purchase coconut wine containers and farm fertilizers. Julita hopes to have better business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase coconut wine containers and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Osiris Vladimir

texts.es: Osiris Vladimir tiene 29 años de edad, actualmente vive con su esposa, que trabaja en un comedor y asi también ella colabora con los gastos del hogar y dos hijos uno de 7 y otro de 10 años, es una persona trabajadora y capaz de salir adelante con lo que se propone, Osiris  posee un microbus que es su medio de trabajo, ya que el transporta personas, es muy conocido en su lugar de residencia a quien sus vecinos describen como alegre y positivo, lo miran cada vez que el emprende sus viajes y es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su familia. Desea reparar su microbus porque hace un tiempo le ha estado fallando y es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito donde  le permitieran comprar materiales como llantas nuevas, bateria, mangueras, ventilador entre otras cosas, y asi seguir trabajando como hasta hoy lo ha hecho. Tiene la certeza que con su trabajo y el apoyo de su esposa podrá cancelar el préstamo solicitado y además espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Osiris Vladimir, 29, lives with his wife and their two children aged 7 and 10.  His wife works in a restaurant and in this way also contributes toward the household expenses.  Osiris is a hardworking person who is capable of getting ahead with his business.  He has a micro-bus that he uses in his work, because he provides passenger transportation services.  He is well-known in the area where he lives; his neighbors describe him as a happy and positive person.  They see him every time he goes out on his trips; this is how he earns a living and supports his family.  He wants to repair his micro-bus because for a while now he's been having some trouble with it.  This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  This loan will allow him to buy new tires, a battery, hoses, a fan, and other parts so that he can continue to work as he has done up until now.  He feels certain that with his work and the support of his wife, he will be able to pay off this loan, and he also expects to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a battery, hoses, a fan, and other parts to repair his vehicle

loans.name: C 8080 Dukore Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and is married with two children; she also takes care of five relatives. She sells various food items such as sugar, Colgate, lotions, soap and toothpaste, and has been working in this field for five years. She is the leader of the C 8080 DUKORE Group which means "we have to work"; she is the one in the photo with a piece of paper in her hand. Jacqueline works from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day of the week and currently employs one person to help her.

Jacqueline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to buy various goods including sugar, Colgate, lotions, soap, and toothpaste for resale.  With any profits earned, she will be able to save for her future, pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as sugar, Colgate, lotions, soap and toothpaste for resale.

loans.name: Mt. Livingston Group

texts.en: Rehema is in her mid 40s, married and the mother of three children, all of whom attend school. For the last six years, she has earned a living by selling food. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. daily and earns a small monthly profit. Rehema is requesting her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used her previous loan to restock her store and pay school fees and household expenses. She repaid the loan successfully and is applying for a new one to buy more food to sell to her customers. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. She will share this loan with her group, "Mt. Livingston," which 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Las Chicas De Genaro 3 Group

texts.es:
Las Chicas de Genaro 3 son un grupo solidario que está en su primer ciclo en Credituyo. La mayoría de las mujeres de este grupo venían de otro grupo, que se llamaban Las Chicas de Genaro pero decidieron separarse y formar un grupo nuevo ya que el otro grupo en el que estaban ya estaba muy grande. Todas las mujeres de este grupo tienen ya más de 20 años de conocerse, ya que viven en una pequeña colonia en donde la mayoría de la genete se conoce.


Maria de la Luz es una de las señoras del grupo. Ella tiene 4 hijos de 18, 16, 12 y 10 años. Su hijo mayor trabaja como operador de maquinaria, mientras que su hija de 16 ya trabaja en un restaurante de comida rápida. Sus dos hijos más pequeños están estudiando. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva deesde hace 2 años. Ella vende esta ropa con las vecinas de su colonia. Este crédito la ayudara para volver a surtir ropa y poderla revender. En un futuro ella quiere comenzar a diversificar sus ingresos y desea poner una tienda de snacks en su casa, ya que quiere tener ingresos extras para poder ofrecerle a sus hijos el mejor de los futuros posibles.
texts.en:
"Las Chicas de Genaro 3" is a solidarity group that is in its first loan cycle with Credituyo.  Most of these women came from another group, also called "Las Chicas de Genaro".  They decided to separate and form a new group because the other group was too large.  All of the women in this group have known each other for more than 20 years.  They live in a small subdivision where most of the people know one another.  

Maria de la Luz is one of the members of this group.  She has four children (ages 18, 16, 12, and 10).  Her oldest son works as a machine operator while her 16-year-old daughter works in a fast food restaurant.  Her two youngest children are studying.  Maria has been selling new clothing for two years.  She sells clothes to the neighbors in her subdivision.  This loan will help her to restock with clothes that she can resell.  In the future, she wants to begin diversifying her income by opening a snack shop in her house.  This will generate extra income so that she can provide her children with better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to resell

loans.name: Milagro De Jesus

texts.es: Milagro de Jesús de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida  en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de la localidad donde reside, es muy conocida pues siempre comercia lo que las personas necesitan a precio accesible además el servicio es excelente; Milagro es una mujer  encantadora, dedicada a lo que ama, su labor tiene grandes expectativas para el futuro por eso aprovechará todas las oportunidades que se le presenten; en las últimas semanas ha aumentado la demanda y quieren incrementar la producción, por eso  le solicita a INTEGAL un crédito que le permita comprar perfumes, cremas, shampú, cosméticos, etc. Milagro de Jesús es muy responsable y está segura que podrá pagar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Milagro de Jesus, 40, lives with her life partner in her own home.  She has a business selling personal products, such as: perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and other products.  Her business is located in the municipal market in the town where she lives, and it is well known because she always sells the products that people need at affordable prices, and her service is excellent.  Milagro is a lovely woman who is devoted to what she loves.  For her work, she has great expectations for the future, and so she will take advantage of all of the opportunities that present themselves.  In recent weeks, she has seen increased demand and her customers want more products.  This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy perfumes, creams, shampoos and cosmetics.  Milagro de Jesus is very responsible, and she is sure that she will be able to pay off this loan and also give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, shampoos and cosmetics

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.en:
In a remote area in the mountains of Xetimamit, San Francisco El Alto located in the Guatemalan highlands, vibrantly green because of the first rains of winter, we met Maria.  She is 50 years old and is married to a tailor. Maria has given birth to a total of 18 children but only 7 are alive.  Maria is very proud of her surviving children, particularly because her older children (18, 15, 16 and 9 years old) have recently decided to return to primary school to get an education.  

Maria became a Friendship Bridge client a couple of years ago because she was determined to make some money on her own to help with household expenses and to pay for her children’s education.  With her first loan, she started a business raising chickens.   Today Maria has 80 chickens and she employs 3 part-time employees.  She is so proud to be able to support others. 

A small part of Maria´s credit is invested in the production of sweatshirts, which her son and her husband produce.  Thanks to Maria, her family is able to work together. Maria’s husband is so proud of her. One of Maria’s dreams is to have a large farm, where she not only raises chickens, but also can raise goats or even bulls, but for that she needs to make a little more income.  It is towards this dream that Maria puts much time and effort in her current business. 

Maria will use this new loan to buy more chickens… and a goat! Maria is currently the treasurer of her trust bank, Nueva Vida (new life), which is composed of nine women whose businesses range from raising livestock, to making garments, to general trading and other activities. This will be the group’s fourth loan cycle together.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Marleny Carolina

texts.es: Marleny Carolina tiene 24 años de edad, y reside junto a su madre esposo e hija. Es ama de casa, y se ocupa de su negocio de pupuseria desde hace muchos años. Además de su negocio de pupuseria también presta el servicio de molino de nixtamal en el cual las personas pueden moler variedad de semillas como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, tomates, etc. de esta forma es como logra llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, ya que ella es el principal soporte económico de su familia. Es muy conocida en la zona por sus vecinos ya que cada día se preocupa por dar lo mejor en sus negocios. Todo esto ha hecho que cada día los clientes la prefirieran más. Ha tomado la decisión de  solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de algunos repuestos para el molino ya que por el uso, necesita algunas mejoras para que continúe funcionando y así poder llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en: Marleny Carolina is 24 years old. She lives with her mother, her husband and her daughter. She is a housewife and she has also looked after her pupuseria business [a restaurant or cafe in El Salvador where pupusas are sold] for many years. Apart from her pupuseria business she also provides a maize milling service whereby people can grind different seeds such as maize, rice, beans, tomatoes, etc. Because of this she manages to feed her family everyday as she is the main breadwinner. She is well known by her neighbors in the area as everyday she strives to provide the best from her businesses. All of this means that her customers like her more everyday. She has made the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of some parts for the mill since it needs some improvements in order to continue functioning. This will allow her to continue to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy some parts for her maize mill, such as discs, pulleys, grease and files.

loans.name: Mercedes Alvarado

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 38 años de edad, y habita junto a su numeroso grupo familiar en casa de su propiedad. Ella se dedica al cultivo de la tierra principalmente siembra: maíz, frijoles y sorgo. Realiza esta activad desde hace muchos años y es así como puede llevar el sustento a su hogar. El cultivo de la tierra es su principal fuente de ingresos, debido a que no conoce otra forma de ganarse el pan de cada día. Con mucho amor y dedicación realiza esta actividad y gracias a su entrega en el trabajo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchas personas, las cuales cada día la prefieren más.  Solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (abonos, semillas, insecticidas, etc.) ya que son indispensables para obtener una cosecha favorable la cual le permita continuar llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 38-years-old and lives with her large family in their own house.  She makes a living by cultivating the land; mainly planting corn, beans, and sorghum.  She has been doing this work for many years and this is how she is able to provide for her home.  Cultivating the land is her main source of income, due to the fact that she does not know another way to bring the bread home each day.  She does this work with much love and dedication, and thanks to her devotion to the job she has managed to earn the trust of many people who prefer her more each day.  

She asks for this loan from INTEGRAL in order to invest in the purchase of necessary supplies (fertilizer, seeds, insecticide, etc.) since they are indispensable to getting a favorable harvest, which will allow her to continue providing for her home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, insecticide, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio de cincuenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos unos de dieciséis y otro de veintidós años; él se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, sandalias, entre otros, su venta la realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes zonas aledañas a donde reside, tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a precios bajos y entregado a la puerta de sus casas; José Antonio es un hombre dedicado a su labor, visionario, con metas claras, una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio. Y ya que aumento la demanda, necesita comprar mayor cantidad de los artículos que comercia, por eso solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar zapatos, sandalias y ropa por mayor. José Antonio  tiene buenas referencias crediticias, está seguro que podrá pagar el préstamo y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia  una mejor calidad de vida,
texts.en:
José Antonio, age 59, lives with his life partner and their two children, age 16 and 22.

He sells clothes, shoes, and sandals, among others.  He sells in an itinerant manner in the different surrounding areas when he lives.  He has a lot of customers.  They know that everything he sells is first quality, has low prices, and is delivered to the door of their houses.

José Antonio is a man devoted to his work.  He is a visionary with clear goals.  One of his goals is to make his business grow.  With the increase in demand, he needs to buy a larger quantity of items to sell.  That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  A loan will allow him to buy shoes, sandals, and clothes wholesale.

José Antonio has good credit references.  He is sure that he will be able to pay back the loan, and at the same time he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, and clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a 38-year-old mother of five. She has taken several courses in hairstyling, cosmetics, and tailoring. Recently Aida decided to expand her small cosmetics salon and branch out into a bridal salon. There is significant potential for a bridal salon in her area and Aida has learned well how to manage her business. She will continue to offer cosmetic and hairstyling services and add bridal styling and bridal wear for rent.

Aida needed this loan to assist with purchasing specialty cloth for dresses, accessories for the bridal wear, and tailoring and sewing tools.

Aida wants to see her bridal salon expand and eventually include a professional stylist, but most importantly, she wants to assist with providing for her family and ensure her children’s education.

loans.use: to assist with purchasing specialty cloth for dresses, accessories for the bridal wear, and tailoring and sewing tools.

loans.name: Hamit

texts.en:
Hamit is a sixty-five-year-old Romani man from the Roma ethnic community of Albanian. He is married and currently has seven children; a grown up daughter passed away some years back. They all live in the outskirts of a major city in the Southeastern Albania, in a barrack made of cardboard and covered with metal sheet. The living conditions are just unacceptable. No water, no toilet, no electricity, and all sleep on the floor on some old blankets and mattresses. 

Kindly note, that visiting this wonderful and loving family, it was a total shock for me, the writer, to see how they lived. I guess I was not strong enough to prevent my tears from running down.

Hamit has been collecting scrap metal for cash. In addition, he has two saws and he is an animal lover. He sells piglets to the locals. Talking about the animals he said, “When they give birth to the little piglets, I sleep with them at the stable, for almost two months, to look after the babies and the mothers.”
 
This is Hamit’s third loan and he is requesting it because he wants to build a one-room house with a toilet and a kitchen. In the past he has proved his responsibility; he has paid off the full amount of the loan and on time. Hamit and his wife seek Kiva lenders’ appreciation in this matter.

loans.use: to build a little one-room house with a toilet and a kitchen for his family

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru:
Анаркан 54 года, вдова, воспитала 5 детей. Анаркан после распада Советского Союза начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан,  ее хозяйство на сегодняшний  день  насчитывает 3 дойные коровы, 5 телят,13 овец и 2 бычков и приносит  около 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота.  Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в ремонт дома и дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства.
texts.en: Anarkan is 54 years old, widowed, and has brought up 5 children. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, Anarkan began breeding livestock, starting her business with 4,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work, Anarkan's farm now has 3 dairy cows, 5 calves, 13 sheep, 2 bull calves, and brings in 6,000 som (KGS) a month. In order to expand her business, Anarkan has asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 35,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional goats and sheep. Anarkan plans to use the earnings from the loan for home repairs and further expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Yesenia Lisseth

texts.es: Yesenia Lisseth de veintiuno años de edad vive junto a sus hermanos; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este rubro por eso se ha hecho de gran experiencia, eso le ayuda a obtener muy buenas cosechas, comercia en todos los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben  que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y aprecios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Yesenia es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante sabe que solo con esfuerzo y dedicación logrará un futuro mejor, en la última cosecha tuvo pérdidas debido al clima y a que no contó con insumos necesarios para asistir sus cultivos, en esta temporada de siembra quiere recuperarse invirtiendo en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, maicillo, fertilizante, insecticida, etc. Yesenia Lisseth tiene grandes expectativas a pesar de ser tan joven es muy responsable está segura que saldará la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yesenia Lisseth is 21 years old and lives together with her siblings.  She works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of corn and sorghum.  She has been dedicated to this line of work for several years.  For this reason she has gained a lot of experience which helps her to obtain very good harvests.  She sells in all the areas around her home and already has many clients who know that everything she sells is of very good quality, at good prices, and furthermore her service is excellent.  

Yesenia is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She knows that only through effort and dedication will she succeed and have a better future.  In the last harvest season, she had losses due to the climate and because she didn't have the necessary supplies to attend to her fields.  For this planting season she wants to recover some of those losses by investing in supplies.  For this reason she is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL that will enable her to buy seed for corn, sorghum, fertilizer, insecticide, etc.  Yesenia Lisseth has great expectations.  Despite being so young, she is very responsible and is sure she will repay her debt and at the same time give her family a greater quality of life.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed for corn and sorghum.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Рачабали более пяти лет занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает запчасти автомобилей. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Рачабали берет кредит для приобретения необходимых запчастей разных марок автомобилей.
texts.en:
Rajabali has worked in trade for more than five years. He rents a store, where he sells spare parts for cars. He is 52 years old. He is married and has five children.

Rajabali takes a loan for the purchase of necessary spare parts for different car brands.

loans.use: to purchase necessary spare parts for different car brands

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.ru: Рокия добрая и заботливая мать пятерых детей. Муж занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Более 10 лет Рокия занимается земледелием, она выращивает и продает сельхозпродукты на местном рынке. Она без трудностей справляется со всеми проблемами своего бизнеса. Она в основном выращивает пшеницу, рис и кукурузу, так как много потребностей на эти продукты. Рокия хочет понять урожайность своей земли, для этого она нуждается в помощи для покупки минеральных удобрений. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 2000 сомони, также на остальную сумму она хочет приобрести семена и горюче-смазочные материалы.
texts.en:
Rokiya is the good and caring mother of five children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Rokiya has been engaged in farming for more than 10 years, she grows and sells agricultural products at the local market. She copes with all problems in her business without difficulty. She mainly grows wheat, rice and corn, as many people need these products. 

Rokiya wants to increase the productivity of the land, and for this she needs help to purchase mineral fertilizers. With this aim she requests a loan in the amount of 2,000 somoni, and further, for the rest of the sum, she wants to purchase seeds, fuel and lubricants.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y se ha hecho de muchísima experiencia que le ayuda a obtener los mejores resultados en las cosechas, el terreno está ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad y lo vende a precios accesibles, además para complementar los gastos del hogar también se dedica al destazo de ganado con la ayuda de su esposo; Reina es una mujer trabajadora, visionaria su más grandes secretos para alcanzar el éxito son las constancia y el amor a su labor, está completamente segura que así llegara a la meta; desde hace algún tiempo quiere aumentar la producción, quiere comprar insumos pero para eso necesita de capital por esa razón le solicitan a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, herramienta, etc. Reina Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago y la capacidad de saldar la  deuda, al mismo tiempo ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel lives with her life partner and her children in their own house.  She makes a living through agriculture, specifically the cultivation of corn.  She has spent several years working in this field and has gotten a lot of experience that helps her obtain the best results from the harvests.  The land is located in an area known for its agriculture and is very close to where she lives.  She sells in all the areas surrounding the town and already has many customers who know that everything she sells is of good quality and is sold at affordable prices.  Additionally, in order to supplement the household expenses she also makes a living butchering cattle with the help of her husband.

Reina is a hard-working woman and visionary.  Her biggest secrets for success are perseverance and the love for her work; she is completely certain that this is how she will reach her goal.  For some time she has wanted to increase production and to buy supplies, but to do this she needs the assets.  This is why she asks INTEGRAL for a loan that allows her to buy corn seed, fertilizer, tools, etc.  Reina Isabel has good payment references and the ability to pay off the debt, while offering her family a better quality of life at the same time.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, fertilizer, and tools.

loans.name: Eder

texts.es: Eder con su anterior credikiva compró papelería, que vendió al público y respondió a un contrato de suministros, con una entidad publica del municipio de Puerto Colombia. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido gradualmente y necesita aumentar su capital de trabajo aun mas,  comprando artículos de papelería y accesorios para celulares. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, pues con ello cada día, tendrá inventarios con que atraer a su clientela y dirigirá esta inversión a artículos que rotan rápidamente convirtiéndola en un éxito. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Les agradezco la ayuda recibida y les deseo muchos éxitos en sus negocios y mucha prosperidad en sus hogares. “
texts.en: With his previous credikiva Eder bought stationary which he sold to the public and fulfilled a supplier contract with a public body from the Puerto Colombia municipality. His business has been gradually growing and he needs to increase his working capital even more to buy stationary and cellphone accessories. This is why he has come for a new credikiva as with this he will have stock to attract customers everyday and he will use this investment for items which have a fast turnaround, generating a profit. His message for the Kiva lenders is the following: "I am grateful for the support I have received and I wish you much success with your businesses and prosperity in your homes".

loans.use: to buy stationary and cellphone accessories

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a personal goal of building a permanent house for her residence. She has been running a pharmacy for the last sixteen years. After her studies, she used her personal savings to start her business. She faces hardships of price fluctuations and stiff competition from her competitors. She has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming, buying land to grow crops, and hiring employees to help expand her business. Mary needs a loan to buy building materials for her house.

loans.use: To buy building materials for her house

loans.name: Kalicha

texts.ru: Каличе 45 лет, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Калича работает учителем в селе Токтогул и с 2004 года в  качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Калича сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях развития своего бизнеса,  Калича обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Калича планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kalicha is 45 years old, married and has five children. Kalicha works as a teacher in the Toktogul village and, as an additional source of income for her family, she has been engaged in livestock breeding since 2004. Thanks to perseverance and hard work, Kalicha was able to grow her business to get a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to develop her business, Kalicha turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of young livestock. Kalicha plans to invest the income from the loan in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to purchase young livestock

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty wants a loan to buy sugar, salt, and rice to sell. She is a 47-year-old hardworking woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She has a responsibility of taking care of her three children, and her dream is to see them graduate with degrees. Inadequate capital to meet the high demand and high rental fees hinder her business; nevertheless, she desires to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, rice, and general merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Десять лет назад Назокат начала свою деятельность в сфере торговли. Она разведенная женщина, сама воспитывает троих детей. Ей трудно одной содержать детей и обеспечивать их всем. Чтобы поставить себя на ноги она начала заниматься купле- продажей детской одежды. Она выбрала данный бизнес, потому что она хочет увидит улыбку на лицах детей. Её торговая точка находится на рынке города. Назокат хотела бы получить займ для покупки товара с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Она и её дети надеяться на вашу помощь, который позволит им улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Ten years ago Nazokat started her activity in the area of trade. She is a divorced woman, and raises three children by herself. It is difficult for her to support the children alone and provide everything for them. 

In order to get herself up on her feet, Nazokat started working with buying and selling children's clothing. She chose this business because she wanted to see the smile on children's faces. Her sales point is at the town market. 

Nazokat would like to receive a loan for the purchase of merchandise in order to replenish working capital. She and her children hope for your help, which will enable them to increase the welfare of the family.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel her practice

loans.name: Gongolamboto One Group

texts.en:
Jeska is in her late thirties and is married with three children who go to school.  She has been a food vendor for five years.  She works from 6:30 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, purchase a radio and cover household expenses; she has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to increase her food stocks and pay for school fees.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Gongolamboto One, which has 17 members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her food stocks and pay for school fees.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. She is a 33 year old married woman living in Masindi,Uganda. She is taking care of her two children, and her dream is to see them attain better lives. She sells clothes, and the business has been very lucrative. She desires to build a permanent house and diversify her business by buying land to grow crops, despite the challenge posed by theft.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane wants a loan to pay school fees for her children. She is 48 years old and charged with the responsibility of taking care of her six children, with whom she lives in Masindi, Uganda. She started with farming, and after a good harvest she sold the proceeds and opened a retail shop. She desires to educate her children and buy land to grow more crops. Price fluctuations and taxes affect her business.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en: Sunny wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. She is 43 years old and single and lives in Masindi, Uganda. Sunny is charged with the responsibility of taking care of two children. Price fluctuations and thieves, coupled with high transport costs, hinder her business. Her desire is to educate her children and buy a motorcycle for a  transport business to diversify her income sources.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Jesus Ruben

texts.es:
Jesús es un hombre de 32 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con su pareja y su pequeño hijo; él es un hombre muy trabajador que tiene un gran deseo de superación y está enfocado en sacar adelante a su familia, incluso en sus ratos libre busca pequeños trabajos para obtener alguna ganancia y en algunas ocasiones le gusta engreír a su familia preparando una riquísima “carapulcra chinchana”; con mucho esmero concluyó sus estudios secundarios, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo seguir una carrera universitaria. 
Gracias a su deseo de salir adelante y con el apoyo de su familia, Jesús trabaja como maestro panadero en una panadería de su ciudad, él trabaja todas las noches un aproximado de 13 horas diarias y el resto del tiempo se dedica con ayuda de su pareja a la crianza y venta de animales, tales como chanchos y patos.
Jesús se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento del corral donde cría y alimenta a sus animales, de esta manera podrá tener mejor acondicionado el ambiente para que los animales crezcan sanos y estén con el peso adecuado para su venta; con ello Jesús espera poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos para ir ahorrando y en un futuro no muy lejano desea poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Jesús is 32, and lives with his partner and small son in the city of Chincha. He is a very hard-working man who has a great desire to improve himself. He is focused on helping his family move forward. Even in his free moments he looks for small jobs to earn some money, and on some occasions he likes to  pamper his family by preparing a very delicious “carapulcra chinchana” (spicy dish made from dried potatoes and pork). 

He did his best in order to complete his secondary education, but unfortunately due to lack of financial resources he was not able to pursue a university degree. 

Thanks to his desire to succeed and with his family's help, Jesús works as a master baker in a bakery in his city. He works every night, approximately 13 hours daily and the rest of the time, with his partner's help, he raises and sells animals such as pigs and ducks.

Jesús is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help he has been provided he will be able to carry out improvements to the pen where he raises and feeds his animals. This way he will be able to have a better equipped environment so that his animals grow up healthy and reach proper weight to be sold. 

With this, Jesús hopes he can increase his income in order to save little by little. In the not-too-distant future he wishes to be able to have his own house.

loans.use: To carry out improvements to the pen where he raises and feeds his animals.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es: Elisa de 68 años de edad habita en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad en condiciones de viuda y madre de dos hijos en las edades de 37 y 38 años. Desde muy joven y durante 11 años,  se dedicó a la actividad comercial en su natal Villanueva, municipio en el departamento de La Guajira al norte de Colombia. Por eso cuando llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, organizó un ciber-café , en el que obtuvo una experiencia de 2 años, para posteriormente emprender con la distribución de pescados y mariscos en otro municipio muy cercano a la ciudad, pues lo consideró mucho más rentable; allí  consiguió buenos clientes  y logró estabilizarse en él, desde el mismo momento en que se trasladó  al municipio donde actualmente  habita. Su negocio lo realiza con instituciones importantes, como  un batallón militar y clínicas, a las que le provisiona de pescados y mariscos para el consumo de su población objeto. Los pagos de estos productos los recibe mensualmente y compra con una frecuencia diaria. En su negocio participan activamente sus dos hijos, que son parte de toda esta tarea, que proporciona  diariamente a estas familias la posibilidad de tener cada vez más,  bienestar en sus hogares. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y es un credikiva, con el cual comprará pescados y mariscos en mayor volumen que el usualmente acostumbrado. Con esta inversión de credikiva ganará descuentos y extenderá su mercado a nuevos clientes que cada vez mas crecen y esto es gracias a que solo vende productos del  mar frescos y saludables,   razón por la cual todo el que los consume, le refieren nuevos compradores y por eso su demanda crece. El mayor desafío de Elisa, es tener un suficiente capital de trabajo para diversificar su negocio y agregar otros productos, como queso, carnes frías, suero,  que se venden de contado y con los cuales ella aprovecharía el actual segmento de mercado, que no ha satisfecho esta demanda y cuando ella lo logre se aumentarán aun mas sus ingresos, tal como ella sueña.
texts.en:
Elisa is 68, lives in a town very close to the city, and is a widow and mother of two children ages 37 and 38.  Since she was very young, and for 11 years, she made a living through commercial activity in her native Villanueva, a town in the department of La Guajira to the north of Colombia.  This is why when she came to the city of Barranquilla, she organized a cybercafe in which she had two years of experience.  Later, she undertook the distribution of fish and seafood in another town close to the city because she considered it to be more profitable.  There she attained good customers and managed to stabilize her business, at the same time that she moved to the town where she currently lives.  Her business works with important institutions, like a military battalion and clinics, to which she provides fish and seafood for the consumption of their target population.  She receives monthly payment for these products and buys on a daily frequency.  Her two children actively participate in her business and are part of this whole task, which provides these families daily with the possibility of having more and more welfare in their homes.  

She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and it is a Kiva loan, which she will use to buy fish and seafood in a greater volume than she is accustomed to.  With the investment of this Kiva loan she will earn discounts and will extend her market to new customers, who will cause it to increasingly grow.  This is thanks to the fact that she only sells fresh and healthful seafood products; the reason for which everyone who consumes them then refers new buyers and causes her demand to grow.  The biggest challenge that Elisa faces is having enough working capital to diversify her business and add more products like cheese, frozen meats, and whey, which she would sell for cash and use to take advantage of the current market segment which has not yet satisfied its demand.  When she achieves this, her income will increase further just as she has dreamed.

loans.use: to buy fish and seafood in bulk.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en: Siraji wants a loan to buy tires for his taxi. He has been in the transportation business for 20 years now. The 50-year-old hard-working man lives in Masindi, Uganda. His dream is to educate his children to attain a degree. Siraji would also like to buy land to grow crops. However, high fuel and transportation costs affect his business.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize and rice to sell.

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir is forty-nine-year-old, married to his wife who was born legally blind in both eyes. Together they have four children, with the youngest one being fourteen years old and in school. Both of them have been in the livestock business for over twenty years with the husband being more involved in it.  They sell milk to dairy farmers who pick up the milk very early in the day. There is a demand for the milk in the region. They are requesting a loan for the first time to add one more cow to their herd. This will help them sell more milk and generate more money.

With the profit, they will be able to afford sending their daughter to secondary school this coming September. Responsibility is one of Fatmir's main character traits and he is confident that he will repay the loan in full without delay.

Fatmir is grateful to the VisionFund Albania and KIVA for the opportunity he’s been granted, because this loan will be a great help to his family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is a thirty-six-year-old married female with four children; she has been a teacher for thirteen years. Her personal goal is educating her children, and she wants money to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a thirty-eight-year-old married man with nine children, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a policeman for six years and is very proud of being part of law and order enforcement. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent house as a residence. Julius intends to use the  money to buy building materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en: Lillian is a 27-year-old single mother of one child living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in agriculture and the retail business for four years. Her challenges are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. Lillian's personal goal is to build a permanent house. Her business  goals are to expand her business to new markets and to move the business to a more permanent location. Lillian wants money buy building materials for constructing her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for constructing her house

loans.name: Paul(Fr)

texts.en: Paul wants a loan to construct a poultry house. He is 60 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He has been raising pigs, and the business is steadily growing since some of the pigs have already given birth to piglets. His challenge is thieves who steal his pigs, but he is positive that the area will soon be secure since the church is about to hire security guards. Paul now desires to diversify his business by venturing into poultry farming.

loans.use: to construct a poultry house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a forty-four-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in spare parts for twelve years. His hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations, and inflation. His personal goal is building a permanent house and his business goal is buying land to grow crops. Joseph wants money to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For six years he has been selling cocoa, which has facilitated him in paying school fees for his children and renovating his house.

Moses is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy more bags of dry cocoa to sell. Inadequate capital is the main hardship he is facing. His business goal is to move his business to a more permanent location and begin exporting cocoa.  His personal goals are to build a permanent house and educate his children up to university.

loans.use: to purchase bags of dry cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Aliija

texts.en:
Aliija is a fifty-seven-year-old man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married with four children and three of them are still in school. His personal goal is to educate his children at  institutions of higher learning so they can attain better qualifications.

The purpose of the loan is to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Iljet

texts.en:
Iljet is in her sixties, married, with three married sons with children of their own. She and her husband live a quiet life on the city’s outskirts. All of their children with their families live in Greece. For over seven years, Iljet has had a cow for milk and a horse to pull the plow. The cow she currently has is getting old now and she is requesting a loan to buy a cow with its calf to supply milk for one of her sons and his family who are returning home, now that the economy is proving to have challenges in Greece. 

In the past she has borrowed twice from VisionFund Albania, however, she has successfully repaid the loans in full. She says, “I have worries when I owe and I can’t sleep well until the installment day comes to pay my portion. I feel relieved afterwards.”

She thanks  all KIVA lenders in advance.

loans.use: To buy a cow with a calf

loans.name: Bobomurat

texts.ru: Бобомурат добрый семьянин, на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 5 лет она занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов, а также купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Каждую неделю он покупает крупно рогатый скот на рынке  соседнего района, затем преподает на местном рынке. Бобомурат в основном выращивает пшеницу, картошку, рис и кукурузу. В ведении  бизнеса помогают дети и жена. Бобомурат запрашивает займ для покупки семян для посева и покупки скота на перепродажу.
texts.en: Bobomurat is a kind-hearted family man raising four children. His wife is a homemaker. For over five years, [he] has been growing produce and also buying and reselling cattle. Every week he buys cattle at the neighboring region’s market and later resells at the local market. Bobomurat mainly grows wheat, potatoes, rice and corn. His wife and children help him in his business. Bobomurat is requesting a loan to buy seeds for the planting season as well as cattle to resale.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cattle.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex  is a thirty-two-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married with two children and he has been operating a hotel for two years now. Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time, unseasonable weather, and inadequate capital are the main hardships  he is facing. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.

His business goal is to increase the number of pigs he is rearing and expand his business into new markets.The purpose of the loan is to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy  pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a twenty-six-year-old woman with two children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She  now sells clothes and she got her initial capital from the profits from her firewood business. Inadequate capital is one of the main hardships she is facing. Her personal goal is to go back for further studies so as to have a better job. 

Her business goal is to move her business to a more permanent location and the purpose of the loan is to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, tiene 35 años de edad , vive con su companero de vida quien trabaja y colabora con los gastos del hogar, dos hijos uno de 4 y 2 años y una sobrina; ella es una persona alegre, trabajadora, dedicada a su familia, desde hace 5 años posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad en su mismo lugar de residencia, comercia lácteos, bebidas dulces, granos básicos, entre otros. Posee buenas relaciones con sus vecinos y es muy colaboradora y eso hace que sea una de las mas beneficiadas a la hora de vender, ya que los vecinos la  prefieren  y esto hace que tenga clientela. Rosalina desea ampliar su negocio, es decir comprar mas productos para tener la tienda mas completa de la zona y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito para comprar mas mercadería y artículos de primera necesidad como,  huevos, leche, pan, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceite, entre otros que aún no posee y sus clientes estan demandando.  Esta segura que con las ganancias que generen éstos nuevos productos podrá solventar la deuda y procurar una mejor vida para su familia.-
texts.en:
Rosalina, 35, lives with her life companion, who works and helps with the household expenses; two children, ages 2 and 4; and a nephew.  She is a happy and hardworking person who is dedicated to her family.

For five years she has had a store in her own home where she sells basic necessities.  She sells dairy products, sweetened drinks, and basic grains, among other things.  She has good relations with her neighbors and is very collaborative, which makes her one of the most favored when it comes to selling, because they prefer her and this increases her clientele.

Rosalina wants to expand her business; that is, buy more products to have the most complete store in the area.  This is why she is asking Integral for a loan to buy more merchandise and basic necessities such as eggs, milk, bread, beans, sugar, rice, and oil, among others that her customers request but that she still doesn't have.

She's sure that with the profits generated by these new products she will be able to repay the debt and get a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, milk, bread, beans, sugar, rice, oil, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for three years. Her hardships are inadequate capital to purchase stock, price fluctuations, and inflation. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. Her business goal is buying land to grow crops and modernizing her salon so as to attract more customers. Eva wants money to buy  synthetic hair for use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair for use in the salon.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Eddie.  He is married and has four children aged 21, 18, 15 and 7 years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help with the household chores.  In 1995, Eddie established his bags, umbrellas and T-shirts business. The business started out of the need to be self-reliant.

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,442,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Eddie has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to increase his stock and expand his business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. In the future, Eddie plans to develop a new shop he has acquired. He says, "The loan will help in increasing my stock."   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bags, umbrellas and T-shirts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an electric mill, and to buy oil, corn, sugar, salt, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es: Hernando inició un negocio por casualidad, cuando teniendo en cuenta que debía hacer producir su lote de tierra, ubicado a un costado de su vivienda, se propuso arrendarlo para generar ingresos; así fue como lo hizo alquilándolo para el funcionamiento de un taller automotriz. pero como su arrendatario incumplió el pago mensual de la obligación, decidió utilizarlo él mismo, teniendo en cuenta que había conocido poco a poco a conductores y propietarios de vehículos, por eso hizo de   su lote un parqueadero, donde alquila  un espacio a cada vehículo, bajo su cuidado. Su idea muy pronto impactó en su clientela objeto y gradualmente ha ido perfeccionándola, con el ingreso diario de 40 vehículos que son sus clientes fijos y otros que pagan por horas o por día su estacionamiento en un sitio seguro. Su mayor desafío es cuando llega la lluvia, pues su lote no todo tiene cubierta y él no tiene suficiente capital de trabajo para adecuar con un techo la totalidad  de su parqueadero y para  proteger todos  los vehículos de sus clientes. Esto lo lleva a no poder aumentar el precio de parqueo y está por debajo de su competencia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual pondrá cubierta al parqueadero, potencializando el aumento de sus clientes y ofreciendo un precio a la medida del mercado, que no lo deje  fuera de la competencia. Su credikiva será exitoso, porque el aumento del precio se ajusta a las especificaciones de los clientes, a quienes Hernando quiere captar,  los cuales guardan sus vehículos en un sitio muy lejos de su lugar de trabajo o vivienda y para ellos esto que va a realizar Hernando es una buena opción.
texts.en:
Hernando started up his business by chance. While considering what he should do with a plot of land, located at the side of his home, he decided to rent it in order to generate an income. This is how he began leasing it out as a vehicle repair shop but because his tenant failed to make the monthly payments, he decided to use it himself as he had slowly got to known the drivers and vehicle owners. He therefore opened his parking lot, where he rents a space to each vehicle under his care. His idea had an impact on his target customers and he has gradually perfected it with the daily income from 40 vehicles, who are regular customers and others who pay for a spot in a secure place by the hour or by the day.

His greatest challenge is when the rain comes as his lot doesn't have a cover and he does not have enough working capital to fit a roof over the entire parking lot and protect all his customers' vehicles. This means that he cannot increase the parking price and he is behind his competition. He is currently applying for a credikiva which he use to put a cover on the parking lot, potentially increasing his customers and charging the average market price, which will not leave him behind his competition. His credikiva will be a success because the price will be adapted according to the specifications of the customers that Hernando wants to attract - those who keep their vehicles a long way from their work or home and for them, Hernando will be a good choice.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put a cover on his parking lot.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos Humberto de cuarenta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica  al cultivo de maíz, frijol, entre otros ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le ayuda a obtener muy buenas cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva está ubicado cerca de la localidad donde vive y se le hace más factible para trasladarse a trabajar, el comercia en todos los alrededores y es muy conocido en la zona porque vende producto de calidad y a muy buen precio además se caracteriza por su amabilidad con las personas; Carlos es un hombre muy dedicado a su labor, piensa que entre más duro trabaja mayor será su recompensa por eso pone todo su esfuerzo , en este tiempo de cosecha quiere aumentar su producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herramienta etc. Carlos Humberto tiene buen record crediticio y tiene muy buenas referencias por eso asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos Humberto is 49 years old and lives with his life companion and their children. He has been growing corn, beans, and other crops for several years. Carlos decided to work in agriculture because he has plenty of experience, which helps him to obtain very good yields. The land he cultivates is located near the town where he lives, so it is very easy for him to get to work. He sells in all of the surrounding areas and is well-known because his products are of high quality and offered at a good price. In addition, he is known for being friendly with people.

Carlos is a man who is very dedicated to his work. He plans to work even harder so that he can be rewarded for all of his efforts. For this harvest he wants to increase production, so he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to purchase corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticides, tools, and other supplies. Carlos Humberto has a good credit record and many good references. He is confident that he can repay his debt and provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds (corn and beans), insecticides, tools, and other supplies.

loans.name: Dora Maria

texts.es: Dora vive en el corregimiento de Campeche, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y su hija de 6 años de edad. De tradición Santandereana, su esposo con experiencia en el comercio a través de tiendas, propias de esta cultura estimuló el emprendimiento del negocio de tienda, donde vender artículos de la canasta familiar al detalle y en unidades de medidas y de peso que su clientela es capaz de comprar. Así fue   Dora aprovechando la experiencia de su esposo como comerciante inició su tienda, en compañía de su cónyuge, con la cual  han logrado la sostenibilidad familiar, trabajando fuertemente y ofreciendo  un  buen servicio   a su clientela, que le ha respondido con un gran reconocimiento, de tal manera que gran parte de los habitantes de todo el corregimiento, compran allí diariamente lo que su familia consume a la hora de alimentarse bien.  Con su tienda esta pareja sostiene su hogar y tiene muchos sueños de crecimiento, como el de tener su propia casa y brindar a su hija la educación que permita convertirla en una profesional exitosa. Las compras las realizan a través de pedidos que hacen en la ciudad de Barranquilla y sus ventas las hace de contado principalmente. Gradualmente los inventarios de productos que rotan con mayor rapidez,  no son suficientes para satisfacer la demanda de su mercado y por eso está acudiendo a un credikiva, con el cual responderá a esta necesidad comprando en mayor volumen y de contado, víveres refrescos, bebidas y carnes frías. Su credikiva será exitoso porque le permitirá ganar descuentos aun mas y porque lo hace en el marco de la rotación de los productos y las necesidades no satisfechas de su clientela, que es la que marca la pauta de las utilidades que generará el negocio y que a Dora y su familia le permitirán vivir cada vez con un mayor bienestar.
texts.en:
Dora live in the village of Campeche, 30 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  She lives with her husband and 6 year old daughter.  Her husband is of the Santanderian tradition and has business experience with stores.  Typical of this culture which stimulated the entrepreneurial growth of stores, they own a store where they sell family retail basket items in units of measurement and weight so that their clientele are able to buy them.  

Utilizing the experience of her husband as a businessman, Dora started the shop with him and they have been able to successfully sustain their family.  They work hard and offer good services to their customers.  They have become well-recognized by most of the village dwellers and they make their purchases there on a daily basis.  They buy what their family needs to consume in order to eat well.  With this store the couple maintains their home and have a lot of dreams of growth. They would like to have their own home and to give their child an education that will allow her to become a successful professional.  

They make their purchases through orders placed in the city of Barranquilla and their sales they make mainly in cash.  Gradually, the inventory that rotates quickest is not sufficient to satisfy the demand of their market and for that reason they are obtaining a loan from Kiva.  With this loan they will respond to this need by purchasing goods in greater volume and in cash: food, refreshments, drinks, and meats.  The kiva loan will be successful because it will allow them to get discounts and even more importantly, because it will help with the rotation of products and satisfy the unmet needs of their clientele.  This is the driving motive of the profits generated by the business, along with the fact that Dora and her family will be able to enjoy improved well-being.

loans.use: to purchase greater volume and in cash: food, refreshments, drinks and cold meats.

loans.name: Chernor Amadu

texts.en:
This is 24-year-old Chernor.  He is single and lives with his two younger sisters.  In 2008, Chernor established his lubricant and provisions business. He began his business to support his sisters’ education and provide livelihood for himself and his sisters. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Chernor has a good loan repayment history. He needs this loan in order to buy a drum lubricant. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a drum lubricant

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es: José Ángel nos cuenta que desde que era un niño su padre le enseñó a él y sus hermanos a trabajar en las finca de café, realizando labores sencillas de limpieza y posteriormente con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo cada vez más hasta convertirse hoy en día en un productor de café. Él está casado desde hace casi 20 años con Hugozina y tienen 6 hijos los cuales les ayudan en las labores del campo y del hogar sin descuidar sus estudios. Toda la producción de José Ángel es orgánica y el necesita comprar planta para renovar su parcela y fertilizantes y por eso necesita el apoyo de un crédito. Él espera que para la próxima cosecha pueda tener un aumento en su producción lo cual se verá reflejado en más ganancias las cuales quiere invertir en un negocio alterno al del café, pues desea poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa. La principal preocupación de él y su esposa es sacar adelante a sus hijos para que tengan mejores oportunidades de las que ellos tuvieron cuando eran jóvenes.
texts.en:
José Ángel says that when he was a boy, his father taught him and his brothers how to work on a coffee farm. They performed simple tasks, such as clearing the fields, and gradually learned to do more and more over time. Today he has become a producer of coffee. José Ángel has been married almost 20 years to Hugozina and they have six children, who help with the chores around the farm and at home without neglecting their studies.

Everything that José Ángel produces is organic. He needs to buy coffee plants and fertilizers to revitalize a parcel of land, which is why he needs the support of a loan. He hopes to increase his production for the next harvest so that can generate more profit to invest in another business besides growing coffee. José Ángel wants to establish a grocery store in his house. The main concern for him and his wife is helping their children move forward so that they can have better opportunities than the ones they had when they were young.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Necetas

texts.en:
Necetas, a 48-year-old married mom of three children, lives in Batibut, Sapang Dalaga, Philippines where she has been sewing for five years. Dresses are designed according to the customer's desired style, but sometimes she creates out of her own will and imagination, each month earning P 6,000, which is fair enough to cover day-to-day expenses.
