Necetas, who joined Gata Daku MPC in 2011, is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc. By having all necessary materials, Necetas hopes to produce as much as she can to earn more income. She is also planning to expand her business and buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials such as textiles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Boli

texts.en:
Boli is 51 years old, married, and has three children who attend school.  She lives in her own house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband is a car driver. Boli has had an agriculture business since 2000. She plants vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, and peppers in her own greenhouse. Boli does not use any chemical composts. Her products are well known by its organic quality. 

Starting in April, Boli plants baby plants and sales them. She not only sells vegetables, she also gives recommendations and guidance about how to plants vegetables to her custumers. 

Boli is requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT, which she will use to buy a net and cover for her greenhouse. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my daughters are in college, they need my support more than ever."

loans.use: to purchase a net and cover for her greenhouse.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 55-year-old Fatu.  She is married and has five children aged 36, 30, 28, 27 and 22 years old. In 1989, Fatu established her textiles business. She began her business to enable her to take care of her family. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 660,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL.

 Fatu requires a loan in order to buy additional cloth for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. Fatu hopes to see her only daughter educated to university level. She is honest and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional textiles for her business

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Merlyn is 46 years old and married with four children. She's from Calabayan, Ozamis City. Merlyn used her last loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Her business is successful, and she's taking out a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah is 24 years old and lives with his mother in a 'ger' (Mongolian yurt) in Hentii province, Mongolia. He and his mother run an organic dairy products retailing business. They have been running the business for 17 years. His mother was operating the dairy product retailing business and he has been helping with the business ever since he was a little boy so he has a lot of experience from his mother.

Galbadrah travels through the countryside to collect organic dairy products including milk, yoghurt and cheese. His products are not mass-produced and therefore, his products don't contain any sort of chemicals. He has been selling the same kind of product ever since they opened the shop. Therefore, he decided to make organic cream. He's requesting 500,000 MNT to buy small machinery for cream making which is a relatively easy process.

loans.use: To buy small machinery to make organic cream with milk

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian, a 45-year-old married father of two, resides in Gata Daku, Clarin, Philippines where he has been planting and harvesting okra, bananas and coconuts for a living for the past five years. Each month, he earns P6,000.

In 2011, Ian joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of P10,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sayra

texts.ru: Сайре 58 лет. В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Сайра начала свой бизнес в торговле, стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Сайра сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 25,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Сайра обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение  ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Сайра  планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса посредством открытия площадки для торговли зеленью и овощами.
texts.en: Sayra is 58 years old. In 2004, in order to support her family, she opened a grocery business with a starting sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Due to Sayra's perseverance and hard work her business flourished and is now yielding 25,000 som (KGS) monthly profits. The grocery store does not currently have a broad selection of groceries and to expand her inventory Sayra has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She is planning to use the profits from this venture to add a fruit and vegetable stand to her store.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Nubia Marisol

texts.es:
Nubia, vive con su familia, se dedica al comercio de ropa, tiene un local fijo donde realiza las ventas, está solicitando un préstamo, para fortalecer el negocio en la venta de ropa, además considera que los préstamos son  una buena herramienta para trabajar y aumentar las ganancias, ella comprara ropa nueva, variada, para damas y caballeros, blusas, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior.
Ella considera que gracias a los créditos anteriores pudo mejorar y ampliar el negocio, aumentando también sus ventas de cosméticos, con ello su familia cuenta con mejor estabilidad económica, mejorando las condiciones de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nubia lives with her family and sells clothing. She makes her sales from a fixed stall. She is requesting a loan to fortify her clothing business. She believes these loans are a good working tool for augmenting earnings. Nubia plans to purchase new and varied clothing for women and gentlemen: blouses, shirts, and dresses, as well as underwear.

Nubia believes that thanks to her previous loans, she was able to improve and expand the business, and also augment her cosmetics sales. With this, her family can count on improved economic stability, and improving life conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, dresses, and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana is a widow who has a child. Cepriana is 56 years old and resides at Malaubang, Ozamis City, Philippines. Cepriana manages a business buying and selling vegetables to earn a living and she's been 7 years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more vegetables.

 In 2011, Cepriana joined GDMPC. In the future, Cepriana wants to build a house and to see her child finish studying.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables

loans.name: Niyolbi

texts.ru: Ниёлби проживает в районе Фархор. Ей 53 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ниёлби арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей женской, детской и подростковой одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки детской летней одежды и женского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Niyolbi lives in the Farkhor region. She is 53 years old, married and has six children. Niyolbi rents a stall at the city market where she sells clothing for women, children and teenagers. She has been working in retail for four years. Niyolbi is taking out this loan to purchase summer clothes for children and undergarments for women to sell at her stall.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothes for children and undergarments for women

loans.name: Erika Del Rosario

texts.es: Erika de 38 años de edad es madre de dos niños en las edades de 7 y 9 años: Ella vive al suroccidente de la ciudad, donde se dedica a la actividad comercial mediante su negocio de variedades que lleva el nombre de sus dos hijos y esto le recuerda diariamente su meta de trabajo disciplinado y persistente, para verlos en el futuro convertidos en personas exitosas. Su negocio nació en el año 2007, cuando decidió buscar la forma de genera ingresos, mediante una actividad independiente; fue así como con $200.000 COP y una pequeña vitrina, producto del ahorro que había realizado en  su economía familiar, dio inicio a su aventura emprendedora, que hoy está ubicada en un adecuado local donde cuenta con 3 vitrinas, tres computadores, una fotocopiadora y enseres, con las que ha logrado el sostenimiento de sus dos hijos y el suyo propio. En su negocio vende papelería, fantasía femenina, detalles para el hogar y dulces y pasabocas. Su meta mas adelante es comprar  un local en la avenida principal que es muy concurrida comercialmente y ampliar su capacidad de ventas y el volumen de sus inventarios que hoy se convierte en el gran desafío para poder cumplir su propósito. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual iniciará su propósito de aumentar su capital y  comprará productos diversos como detalles para el hogar, papelería, bisutería, dulcería y pasabocas, pues son los productos de mayor rotación que garantizan la venta rápida y el éxito de su inversión credikiva.
texts.en: Erika, 38, is the mother of 2 children aged 7 and 9.  She lives to the southwest of the city, where she has a commercial business.  She has a variety shop that carries the name of her two children; this reminds her daily that her goal is to work in a disciplined and persistent way so that she can see her children become successful people.  She started her business is 2007, when she decided to look for a way to generate income through an independent activity.  With 200,000 Colombian pesos and a small glass display case, financed with money that she had saved from the household budget, she started her entrepreneurial adventure.  Now her business is located in a suitable space where she has 3 glass display cases, 3 computers, a photocopier and other equipment.  With this business, she has managed to support herself and her 2 children.  There she sells stationery items, women's accessories, home accents, sweets and snacks.  Her goal for the future is to buy a store on the main street where it is busy with a lot of commerce, and expand her inventory and her sales capacity.  Now she will make accomplishing this goal her greatest challenge. This is the reason she approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her first Kiva loan.  Through this loan, she will start working toward her goal of increasing her capital by purchasing a diverse set of products.  She will buy: accents for the home, stationery products, costume jewelry, sweets, and snacks, as these are the products with the greatest rotation, guaranteeing her rapid sales and the success of her Kiva-financed investment.

loans.use: to buy accents for the home, stationery products, costume jewelry, sweets and snacks

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: El señor Marlon Rizo es propietario de un taller de carpintería ubicado en la comunidad de el salto, municipio de san Rafael del sur, su especialidad es la producción de ropero de tres cuerpos, elaborando una buena cantidad al mes, su mercado está dirigido en abastecer de este producto a comerciantes del mercado de la ciudad de Rivas, y el mercado oriental en Managua, actualmente necesito un financiamiento con ceprodel san Rafael del sur para poder atender las exigencias de su clientela que le están demandando mayor cantidad de roperos al mes.
texts.en: Mr. Marlon Rizo owns a carpenter’s shop in the Salto community South San Rafael municipal. He specializes in making dressers of 3 sections. He makes a large amount every month. He supplies this product to shoppers in the Rivas market and Oriental market located in Managua. At the moment he is requesting South San Rafael Ceprodel a loan to meet his client’s demands since they are requesting more orders of his product.

loans.use: buy materials to make dressers: cedar blocks and planks.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en el negocio de medicamentos, se comprara una variedad de productos naturales y químicos, vitaminas, antihistamínicos, antibióticos, que le permitan poder atender las necesidades de los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, manifiesto que fue positivo, pues ha logrado sobrevivir de sus ventas, ampliando su negocio, esto le ha permitido seguir ofreciendo a los clientes  buenos productos, tambien con su familia ha mejorado su situación.
texts.en:
Marta is requesting a new loan, and plans to invest the funds from the loan in her natural medicine business. She plans to purchase a variety of natural products and chemicals, including vitamins, antihistamines and antibiotics, products which will help her to more thoroughly attend to her clients' needs. 

She is grateful for her previous loan, which allowed her to grow her business and offer her clients higher quality products. The loan also helped her improve her family's quality of life and situation.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, antihistamines and antibiotics.

loans.name: Victoria Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Victoria es comerciante tiene una pulpería ubicada en san pablo, tiene una demanda fuerte, con excelentes cliente.

Ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a esta actividad y así obtener mejores utilidades y el crecimiento de su negocio, y así obtener mejor condición de vida de su familia. El dinero lo solicito para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, productos lácteos como el queso la leche, crema.
texts.en:
Mrs. Victoria owns a local store located in San Pablo, has a large demand, and has excellent clients.

She has dedicated a large amount of her life to this business to obtain better utilities, grow her business, and improve her family's quality of life. She will use the loan to buy basic grains such as rice, oil, beans, and dairy products such as cheese, milk, and cream.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, beans, and dairy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shrimp, lobsters and clams.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, para invertir en el negocio, surtiéndose de mas mercadería como CD Y DVD, frazadas, colchas y cortinas, con el objetivo de seguir ofreciendo a los clientes una variedad en su mercadería.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, fue positivo ya que realizo una buena inversión, de la cual ha logrado mantenerse en el negocio y tambien ha podido llevar a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en:
Luis is requesting a new loan, which he plans to invest in his business by purchasing additional merchandise, such as CDs, DVDs, blankets, quilts and curtains. He hopes, with this increase in stock, to increase the variety of products he offers to his customers.

He is grateful for his previous loan, which allowed him to invest in his business, continue with his business and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, DVDs, blankets, quilts and curtains.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es: Ricardo Antonio de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos  en casa propia, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene quince años de dedicarse al trabajo y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas y al mismo tiempo  muy buenas ganancias que le permiten mantener su hogar, el terreno donde cultiva está ubicado en una zona con incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en los lugares aledaños y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben que todo lo que vende es de muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Ricardo es un hombre emprendedor, muy dedicado a su labor siempre está luchando por alcanzar un futuro más próspero y busca las mejores oportunidades para poder superarse, la última cosecha no fue muy buena y tuvo un cuarenta por ciento de perdida debido a las lluvias, en este periodo de siembra que se acerca quiere aprovechar y recuperarse pero necesita invertir en insumos por eso decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, herbicida, insecticida etc. Ricardo Antonio se caracteriza por ser muy responsable y tiene muy buenas referencias de pago, está seguro que podrá saldar la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ricardo Antonio is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his life companion and their two children. He has been engaged in agriculture, especially the cultivation of corn, for 15 years. Ricardo chose this line of work because he has valuable experience that enables him to obtain good yields and also generate good income for maintaining his household. The land he cultivates is located in a farming area near his home. He sells in the neighboring areas and has many customers who know that everything he offers is of good quality and provided at an affordable price. In addition, his service is unequaled.

Ricardo is an enterprising man who is very dedicated to his work. He always strives to achieve a more prosperous future and looks for better opportunities that allow him to excel. His last harvest did not have good results since he suffered a 40% loss because of the rains. For this next planting season, he wants to take advantage of this time to recover, but he needs to invest in supplies. He decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy corn seeds, compost, herbicides, insecticides, and other supplies. Ricardo Antonio is known for being very responsible and having good payment references. He is confident that he can repay his debt and, at the same time, provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, compost, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, desea continuar mejorando su negocio, realizando inversiones periódicas de prendas de vestir para atraer a los clientes, este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropa blusas, faldas, pantalones, ropa interior, para mantener el negocio bien surtido y poder atender la demanda.
La experiencia que Marta obtuvo con el préstamo anterior, fue buena porque logro tener variedad de prendas y además creció y atendió a más clientes, en el aspecto familiar se han mejorado las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marta wants to continue improving her business, regular investing in clothing in order to attract customers, she will invest this loan in clothes, buying tops, skirts, trousers and underwear in order to keep the business well stocked and to be able to meet demand.

Marta's experience with her previous loan was good because she managed to obtain a variety of stock and also grew and serve more customers. In her personal life, her quality of life has improved.

loans.use: to buy clothes: tops, skirts, trousers and underwear.

loans.name: Yaneth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yaneth, quiere seguir trabajando en la agricultura con su familia y en la venta de semilla de marañón, por esta situación solicita un préstamo para comprarse los materiales como el abono, herbicidas y la preparación del terreno, con este dinero lograra iniciar su siembra y comprarse una buena cantidad de semilla cruda.
Su efecto con el préstamo anterior fue favorable, ya que hizo las inversiones necesarias en la venta de mariscos, teniendo una buena respuesta en sus ventas, ya que le ha quedado un margen de ganancia, esto le ha permitido mejorar algunos aspectos en su familia.
texts.en:
Yaneth wants to continue working in agriculture with her family and selling cashews, because of this she is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies like manure, herbicides and to fund the preparation of the land. With this money she will be able to begin sowing and buy a good amount of raw seeds.

The previous loan had a beneficial effect, she has already made the necessary investments into seafood sales, having had a good response to her sales, she has retained a profit margin. This has allowed her to improve some aspects of her family life.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicides and prepare the land.

loans.name: Miniru

texts.en: This is 27-year-old Miniru. He is married and has 2 children aged 3 and 6 years. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help a younger brother with his education. In 2007, Miniru established his provision and drinks business. He began his business after dropping out from school, to enable him to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. Miniru has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to add to his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Miniru plans to move his business from a kiosk to a concrete shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for provisions and drinks

loans.name: Battseren

texts.en:
Battseren is 30 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in her husband's company's house in Govisumber province, Mongolia. Her husband is a repairman and her daughter is a student. 

She started her women’s accessory shop business in 2009. Her shop location is good and her products are elegant and pretty affordable. Her business income is stable. 

However, her income has been pretty much the same since she opened the shop. Therefore, she decided to open a small playground for children which includes toy cars and bicycles. She is requesting 1,540,000 MNT to purchase toy cars and bicycles.

loans.use: to purchase toy cars and bicycles for her playground business.

loans.name: Buuzara

texts.ru: Буузаре  45 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. В 1990 году в  качестве основного  источника дохода для своей семьи, Буузара начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Буузара сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  в 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Буузара обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота - молодняка.  Доходы от кредита Буузара планирует вложить в увеличение количества скота.
texts.en: Buuzara is 45 years old, married and has two children. In order to support her family Buuzara has been raising livestock for sale since 1990. She started her business with 5,000 som (KGS) and due to her perseverance and hard work, it now yields 8,000 som (KGS) monthly profits. Buuzara has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) which she plans to use for purchasing more cattle. She will use the profits from this expansion to continue expanding her herd.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mazbut

texts.ru: Мазбут проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Он женат. Ему 54 года. У него трое детей. Мазбут занимается скотоводством. Он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Mazbut lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Mazbut raises cattle for meat sales for a living. He has had his herd for 15 years. Mazbut is taking out this loan to purchase more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Илхом проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Илхом более 20 лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа коровы и телят с целью увеличения поголовья крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Ilhom lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 40 years old, married and has five children. Ilhom has been raising livestock for 20 years. He specializes in cattle which he sells at the meat market. Ilhom is taking out this loan to purchase a cow and calves so that he can expand his herd.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and calves

loans.name: Francisca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Francisca, quiere seguir con su actividad agrícola, cultivando maíz tambien en la venta de verduras, para esto deberá iniciar con la compra de abono, semillas, herbicidas e insecticidas, para aplicarlos y poder prevenir el cultivo de plagas, además ella continua con su venta de leche, proveniente de la ganadería, ella manifiesta estar en mejores condiciones, apoyando a su familia en lo necesario.
Tuvo un efecto positivo con el préstamo anterior, en su familia pues considera en lo material ir mejorando, pues ha realizado algunas compras de artículos para el hogar, en la fuente de trabajo ha mejorado porque se mantiene con la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Francisca wants to continue with her farming activity, cultivating corn as well as selling vegetables, in order to do this she must begin my buying manure, seeds, herbicides and pesticides, so she can apply them and prevent the spread of pests. She also continues selling milk from livestock. She appears to be experiencing improved living conditions and supporting her family in what is necessary.

Her previous loan had a positive effect on her family, whose conditions are improving as she managed to buy several items for their home. The supply of work has improved as maintains herself with fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is married with 4 children. She is 32 years old and lives in Mentering, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alma owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 4,700 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,400 to purchase farm chemicals. Alma been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2009. In the future, Alma aims to make business progress and expansion.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes de 49 años vive con su cónyuge y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 16 a 30 años. Ella inició su negocio cuando procedente de Buenaventura, el Puerto marítimo más importante en la región del Pacífico Colombiano, llegó a la ciudad para buscar mejores alternativas de vida pacifica y productiva para su familia. Mercedes había adquirido su experiencia de tienda en su tierra natal y una vez se trasladó a la ciudad de Barranquilla,  la re- tomó y la convirtió en su forma de generar ingresos, apoyadas por su familia que la recibió con una gran acogida. Su meta es lograr la plena sostenibilidad de su negocio y por eso debe crecer, en la misma proporción que lo hace su clientela, pero sus inventarios no son suficientes para responder a ellos con las mercancías que mas rotan. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará víveres, ranchos y verduras, en mayor volumen con lo cual logrará mejores descuentos que capitalizará y harán que su negocio sea mas rentable y su rotación total sea mayor;  indicadores financieros que en la actualidad están en 15% promedio el primero y la rotación de inventarios en 30 días. Esto es justamente lo que convertirá a la inversión de credikiva en potencialmente exitosa, porque gradualmente impactará el crecimiento de esta tienda.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 49, lives with her spouse and has four children between the ages of 16 and 30.  She started her business when she came from Buenaventura, the most important maritime port in the Colombian Pacific region.  She came to the city in search of better alternatives for a peaceful and productive life for her family.

Mercedes had acquired her store experience in her native region and, once she moved to the city of Barranquilla, she took it up again and turned it into her means of generating income.  She was helped by her family, who received her with a warm welcome.

Her goal is for her business to be sustainable, and for this she needs to grow in the same proportion as her clientele.  However, her inventory is not enough to respond to their needs with the merchandise that turns over most.

For this reason she is asking for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will buy provisions, food and vegetables, wholesale so she will get better discounts that she will reinvest to make her business more profitable and her total turnover greater.

These financial indicators are currently at an average of 15% on the first one and a 30-day inventory turnover.  This is exactly what will convert her Kiva loan into potential success, because gradually it will impact the growth of her store.

loans.use: to buy wholesale food and vegetables.

loans.name: Wilmer Enrique

texts.es: Hacia los municipios del Sur Occidente del departamento del Atlántico, viaja diariamente Wilmer, distribuyendo puerta a puerta  productos naturales que contienen multivitamínicos, calcio  tratamientos de belleza, colonias y cremas dentales. Wilmer ha sido muy acogido entre su clientela y cada vez son mas el número de clientes que lo espera para comprarle. En su negocio, realiza las compras directamente a los mayoristas y   vende los artículos al detalle, mediante las modalidades de crédito y de contado. Su meta mas adelante es ampliar la cobertura de su negocio y dirigir sus acciones de mercado, hacia Barranquilla y su área metropolitana, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para cumplir su propósito de crecimiento. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará nuevos productos que aun no vende, como masajes capilares, shampoo y productos de aseo. Con la inversión de su credikiva, ampliara las   posibilidades de compra de sus clientes  y potencializará el incremento en las ventas, lo cual también es el incremento de sus ingresos, que mejoran el bienestar de su familia,  conformada por su esposa y su hijo de 12 años.
texts.en: In the South Western municipal, of the Atlantic department, Wilmer travels there daily to sell multivitamins, calcium, beauty treatments, colognes, and toothpaste door to door. Wilmer is well received by his clients and more and more clients order products from him. He buys products wholesale and sells the at retail prices. He accepts cash and credit. His goal is to begin selling in markets in Barranquilla and the metropolitan area but he lacks the funds to expand his business. This is why he is requesting Kiva a loan. This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will buy products he does not sell yet such as hair treatments, shampoo, and cleaning products. With this loan he will be able to offer his clients a larger variety of products, increase sales, and increase profits to benefit his family’s well-being. His family of formed of his wife and 12 year old son.

loans.use: hair treatments, shampoo, and cleaning products

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar de 49 años de edad vive en la ciudad con su esposa y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 19 y 27 años. Allí en un local comercial él y su cónyuge trabajan arduamente, para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia; mientras él  diariamente vende accesorios para celulares  y atiende un servicio de telecomunicaciones, mediante celulares, su cónyuge se dedica a la venta de comidas. Con estos dos negocios la pareja ha logrado de la mano de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, formalizar su actividad, obteniendo los registros mercantiles,  también ha fortalecido el manejo administrativo participando en actividades formativas empresariales, además de que ha accedido a 6 financiamientos, que lo han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo, tener inventarios dirigidos a lo que requiere su exigente  clientela en el tema modernidad de estos artículos y todo esto lo ha logrado  durante 4 años de encontrarse vinculado a esta organización. Su meta más adelante es comprar la totalidad e su vivienda y construir un segundo piso, para separar las actividades de trabajo de su vida familiar, logrando así un mayor sosiego  y disfrutar aun mas de su hogar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará nuevos y modernos celulares para impactar a su clientela en el marco de la demanda que hay de ellos, así mismo invertirá en accesorios y recargas que le producen una utilidad adicional y en la cual ha venido incursionando poco a poco y conoce que es muy rentable este nuevo negocio, con el que quiere ganar aun mas, para beneficiar sus ingresos que están muy relacionados con el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Cesar, who is 49 years old, lives in the city with his wife. He has two children who are 19 and 27 years old. In a commercial local he and his wife work hard to meet the needs of their family. Daily he sells accessories for cell phones and provides telecommunications services for cell phones. His wife earns income by selling food. With these businesses the couple have been able to, with the support of the 'Fundación Mario Santo Domingo' formalize their business, by obtaining the sales certification and strengthening the administration of the business by participating in business training activities. He has taken out six loans, which have allowed him to increase his working capital, have inventory that is current with recent technology that is in demand by his customers. All of this he has achieved in the past four years that he has been connected to this organization.    

His goal for later on down the road is to buy the house where he lives and build a second level, to separate the business activity from his family life. Creating a more calm atmosphere will allow him to enjoy his home more. 

He is currently requesting a loan through Kiva, which he will use to buy new, modern cell phones, to be able to meet the demands of his clients. He will also invest in accessories and chargers, which is a new part of his business, to provide additional items, which have proven to be a profitable. With this he will be able to increase his income, which are closely related to improving the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy new and modern cell phones, accessories and chargers which are in demand by his customers.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: La venta de productos desechables, es la fuente de ingresos de Luis Carlos; un hombre de 38 años que llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla desde San Antero en Córdoba, uno de los  departamentos más ganaderos de Colombia. A sus 17 años se vinculó como trabajador de depósitos de víveres de la ciudad;  allí fue donde adquirió su mayor experiencia emprendedora y del mercado cambiante, especialmente en el área de las ventas; con la que tres años después, logró  independizarse y generar su propia idea, con la que ganara dinero de manera independiente. Fue así como con sus ahorros provenientes de su trabajo de  empleado, compró un pequeño local en un sector del mercado público de la ciudad y se provisionó de productos desechables, como bolsas, vasos, platos, cubiertos cucharas, pitillos etc; posteriormente adecuó una refresquería  que le ha producido nuevos ingresos y la cual también quiere hacer crecer, debido al potencial de clientes que gira en torno a sus instalaciones locativas. Sus principales clientes son los restaurantes y vendedores de refrescos, como el que en la costa le llaman “Raspao”, un famoso granizado de esencias naturales de frutas, como tamarindo, limón, naranja  etc. También son sus clientes, agencias que venden panelas, vendedores de frutas que adquieren bosas plásticas y otras empresas que compran estos productos en diversas cantidades y especificaciones. Su meta mas adelante, es convertirse en mayorista de productos desechables, pero su gran desafío, es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para lograrlo efectivamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, con el que comprará bolsas  plásticas, artículos de fiestas en icopor, así como también refrescos y bebidas, para provisionar su refresquería. Con ello inicia su camino al cumplimiento gradual de su propósito de crecimiento y esto gracias a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que le garantiza tener un inventario de productos que rotan fácilmente, para atender su demanda permanente y ganar cada vez mas dinero con el que cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos' source of income is the sale of disposable products. He is 38, and came to the city of Barranquilla from San Antero en Córdoba, one of the main livestock-raising departments in Colombia. 

When he as 17, he signed on as a worker in food warehouses in the city. That was where he acquired his major entrepreneurial experience and knowledge of the ever-changing market, especially in the sales area. So three years later, he managed to go it alone and create his own venture with which to earn money independently. This was how, with his savings from his work as an employee, he bought a small shop in an area of the city's public market and supplied himself with disposable products such as bags, glasses, plates, cutlery, spoons, straws, etc. 

Subsequently he fitted up a refreshment stand that has produced new income for him and which he also wants to make grow, due to the potential clientele  centering around his business location. His main customers are restaurants and soft drink sellers, such as what they call on the coast, “raspao”, a well-known shaved ice with natural fruit flavors, such as tamarind, lemon, orange, etc. His customers also include stores selling brown sugar loaf, fruit sellers who buy plastic bags, and other companies that buy these products in various quantities and specifications. 

His goal is to someday become a wholesaler of disposable products, but his great challenge is not having sufficient working capital to really achieve it. This is why he is applying for a credikiva loan, with which he will buy plastic bags, disposable party items, as well as soft drinks and other beverages for supplying his refreshment stand. 

With this, he is on his way to gradually achieving his growth objectve, and this thanks to his credikiva, the first loan he is taking out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This assures him of having a product inventory with easy turnover, in order to serve his constant customer demand, and to earn more and more money with which to realize his dream.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, disposable party supplies, as well as soft drinks and other beverages.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para invertir en la producción de la comida rápida, para poder seguir prestando un buen servicio a los clientes, comprándose, pan, carnes, salchichas, papas, aceite y condimentos,  esto le ayudara para seguir en la venta de hamburguesas, panes, tortas y tacos, papas fritas.
El manifiesto haber tenido un buen efecto con la inversión anterior, que le hizo incrementar las ganancias y el buen servicio a los clientes, ha agregado la venta de hamburguesas y papas fritas.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to invest in the production of fast food, in order to continue providing good service to his customers by buying bread, meats, sausages, potatoes, oil and condiments. This will help him to continue selling hamburgers, breads, cakes, tacos and potato chips.

He states that the previous loan had a good effect and that he has increased his earnings and good service to his customers. He has added the sale of hamburgers and potato chips.

loans.use: to buy bread, meats, sausages, potatoes, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Esperanza  de 52 años  es madre de dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 27 años; ella vive al sur occidente de la ciudad donde, desde hace 2 años, inició su negocio vendiendo mercancía varada a los conductores de una línea de buses locales con los que construyó su clientela base. Poco a poco su mercado fue extendiéndose porque los buenos precios que ofrece y los plazos acomodados a las posibilidades de sus buenos clientes, a los cuales escoge con mucho cuidado; ella también empezó en ese mismo periodo otra actividad, la de vender minutos a celulares y en esa época solo tenia un plan de voz. Hoy cuenta con 6 planes y bajo un paraguas en un espacio de gran concurrencia peatonal, trabaja con operadores diferentes y con un mercado que le permite obtener ingresos mediante la venta de este servicio, que hoy ya es muy reconocido.  En su negocio de venta de mercancías, la recuperación de cuentas por cobrar, la hace semanalmente, quincenalmente o mensualmente;  ella para poder comprar debe esperar a recoger el dinero producto de las ventas a crédito y luego responde a pedidos de clientes reales o de nuevos clientes. Esto es cada vez mas un gran desafío,  porque su clientela está en crecimiento y su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente ante la demanda; en la actualidad está acudiendo a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará un paquete de voz del operador que mas mueve su mercado, y ropa y calzado que han solicitado sus clientes y que ella planea responder con la aplicación de su credikiva a esta compra.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 52 years old, and is the mother of two children, ages 22 and 27. She lives in the southwest district of her city where, over two years ago, she started her own business selling a wide variety of merchandise to bus drivers, who make up her customer base. Little by little, she expanded her business and grew, since she offers good prices and excellent customer service. Around the same time, she also started selling cell phone credit and minutes. Originally, she only had one voice and cell plan, but she now operates a call center and sells minutes and credit on 6 different plans from a station underneath an umbrella that she has set up on a popular pedestrian route. She is able to supplement her income with this other business, as it is very well known.

In her merchandise sales business, she has the ability to offer her customers sales on credit, and collects accounts receivable weekly, every two weeks, or monthly. In order to make merchandise purchases to restock her business, Esperanza has to wait to collect payments from her clients. This presents her with a significant challenge, since her customer base is growing, but her working capital is insufficient to cover customer demands. This is her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and with Kiva, and she plans to use the support from the loan to purchase a voice operator package for her call center, as well as clothing and footwear to stock her merchandise business.

loans.use: to purchase a voice operator package for her call center, as well as clothing and footwear for her merchandise business.

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
La señora Julia,  de 58 años de edad,  madre soltera es originaria de Granada tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad de vida independiente. Ella es  de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de zapato y chinelas inicio su actividad con poca mercadería  vendiendo en el mercado, luego de las pocas ventas que hacia en el día iba ahorrando para invertir en su negocio hasta llegar a tener buen inventario, con el tiempo vio la necesidad de surtir mas el negocio y con el apoyo de instituciones invirtió aun mas en su negocio donde actualmente recibe el apoyo de una hija, sus productos los comercializa en los alrededores de Granada ya que cuenta con buena demanda de parte de los clientes aunque también ayuda el lugar ya que es una zona muy habitada y visitada por los turistas, su expectativa es mantenerse activa con mas mercadería. 
Realiza el préstamo para comprar chinelas para esta temporada de invierno pues hay más demandas, ella estima que el crédito le ayudara porque podrá ofrecer mas variedades de productos a sus clientes obteniendo mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es de las ganancias ir guardando la mitad en su cuenta de ahorro para asegurar su futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia, age 58, is a single mother who is originally from Granada. She has three grown children who live independently. Julia is a merchant who sells shoes and flip-flops. She started her business with little merchandise to sell at the market. Later on, with the sales she made, she was able to save enough money to invest in her business and have a better inventory. As time passed, she saw the need to buy more stock for her business. With the help of financial institutions, she was able to invest more into her business and now her daughter helps her. Her products are sold in the surrounding areas of Granada and there is demand from her customers. It also helps that the place where she sells is heavily populated and frequented by tourists. Her expectation is to remain active by acquiring more merchandise.

Julia will use this loan to buy flip-flops since there is more demand during the winter season. She estimates that the loan will be of help because she will be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and generate more earnings. Her plans include directing half of her profits into a savings account so that she can secure her future.

loans.use: to purchase a large shipment of flip-flops.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar es comerciante de línea de ropa ubicada en san Rafael del sur y Managua, el antes de tener este negocio era vendedor y cobrador de líneas de ropa de personas que se dedicaban a esta actividad, con el tiempo el adquirió experiencia y habilidades necesarias en este sector, por lo que emprendió la idea de tener su propia línea de ropa, actualmente con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación tiene cuatro líneas, una ubicada en la zona de san Rafael y las otras tres se encuentran en Managua, el total de clientes atendidos es de 750 clientes, con una cartera de C$ 176,250.00
texts.en: Sr. Oscar has his own clothing business.  He operates the business in San Rafael and Managua.  He was a salesman before, selling clothing to people who engage in that trade and he picked up the experience and skills he needed to start his own business.  After much hard work, he used what he learned to start four "lineas" (not sure in this context: stores, perhaps?), one in San Rafael and three others in Managua.  He now has 750 customers and a turnover of C$176,250.00.

loans.use: to stock his retail clothing business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha tiene 38 años, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos y esposo en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la localidad de Cajas Chico.  
Desde hace 2 años comenzó su negocio de venta de comida, jugos y golosinas en un terreno que le dieron sus padres. Junto con su esposo decidieron vender platos típicos y hacer un restaurante campestre en ese terreno, aún no concretan su sueño, pero se encuentran ahorrando y cada vez que pueden, mejoran la infraestructura de su local. Mientras tanto, todos los días prepara desayunos y almuerzos para los trabajadores de construcción que laboran cerca de su casa. En todo este tiempo ha visto que es un negocio rentable a pesar de las diversas dificultades como el alza repentina del precio de los alimentos. Por esta razón, ideó una estrategia para abastecerse de los ingredientes no perecibles, comprando en grandes cantidades, ya que así reduce el costo de su inversión. 

Este su segundo crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasmada de saber que tendrá una experiencia con expectativa de éxito, por lo que decidió tener un actitud responsable para acceder a un nivel mayor de confianza en sus futuros créditos. A la vez, agradece por esta oportunidad de apoyo en su crédito que le servirá para mejorar su negocio.
Martha invertirá el dinero en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para preparar sus platos de comida.
texts.en:
Martha is 38 years old and lives at her parents' house with her husband and two children. They reside in the town of Cajas Chico. Two years ago, Martha started a business selling food, juices, and sweets on a piece of land given to her by her parents. She and her husband decided to sell traditional dishes and build a countryside restaurant on this land, but that dream has yet to be fulfilled. In the meantime, they save whenever they can and make improvements to the infrastructure of their shop. Every day, Martha prepares breakfast and lunch for the construction workers who have jobs near her house. Most of all, she has seen her business become profitable despite of the various difficulties she has had to deal with, such as the constant rise in food prices. For this reason, she came up with a strategy for stocking up on non-perishable ingredients and buying them in large quantities so as to reduce the cost of her investment.

This is her second loan with MFP and she is very excited to know that she will have a successful experience. Martha has decided to adopt a responsible attitude so that she can achieve the highest level of trust required for obtaining future loans. For now, she is grateful for having this opportunity to receive a loan for improving her business. Martha will invest the money in the purchase of basic ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to purchase basic ingredients for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Teresa  se dedica a producir y vender pan desde hace muchos años, oficio que aprendió cuando trabajaba en una panadería particular, cuando manejaba muy bien el trabajo fue motivada en construir un pequeño horno artesanal y en tener su propio negocio, actualmente comercializa su producto en el mercado municipal y en algunas pulperías del sector, su plan de inversión fue destinado en comprar harina y leña.
texts.en: Teresa makes a living baking and selling bread, and has worked in this trade for many years. She learned the art of bread making when she worked in a bakery, and when she had mastered the trade she decided to build a small, artisan oven in her home to start her own business. She presently sells her products in the local market, as well as in some smaller general stores in the area. Her plan for investing this loan consists of purchasing flour and firewood for making bread.

loans.use: to purchase flour and firewood.

loans.name: May

texts.en: May is a married woman who has two children. She is 28 years old and resides in Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines. May has been a corn farmer for five years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. In 2011, May joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
This is 58-year-old Alpha. He is married and has four children aged 7, 10, 15 and 21. He has three additional dependents, who live with him to assist in the business. In 1996, Alpha established his cooking utensil and plastic products business. The business started to enable him be self reliant and provide a livelihood for his family. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,300,000 Leone (SLL) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Alpha has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cooking utensils and other plastic products. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Alpha plans to open another shop at the outskirts of town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cooking utensils, plastic bowls and buckets

loans.name: Kimberlis

texts.es: Kimberlis es una mujer casada que tiene 1 hijo en la edad 3 años y habita al sur occidente de la ciudad.  Desde la madrugada empieza su rutina diaria de lunes a domingo, siendo los días de mayor movimiento en las ventas los fines de semanas y festivos. Ella se dedica a la preparación de comidas y productos fritos, negocio que nació por la necesidad de ofrecer a su familia mayores posibilidades de bienestar, mediante un ingreso más que impulsara su desarrollo. Su meta mas adelante, es lograr fortalecer su negocio, hasta convertirlo en un restaurante muy reconocido por su clientela en función de sus productos y de su ambiente confortable. Últimamente sus ventas se han incrementado y no tiene el capital de trabajo suficiente para hacer compras en mayor cantidad, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el que comprara en mayor volumen y de contado aceites, maíz e insumos para la preparación de sus comidas. Con ello se provisionará de un inventario comprado a un precio competitivo, que resiste los aumentos de los alimentos, ganándose  así la diferencia en dinero por concepto del usual incremento que ocurre en estos productos y esto es lo que garantiza el éxito de su credikiva, acompañado de su disposición parta el trabajo y buena fe en el manejo cuidados de esta inversión.
texts.en: Kimberlis and her husband have one child, a 3-year old boy.  They live in the Colombian city of Barranquilla.  Kimberlis operates a business making and selling fried snacks.  She started the business because she needed a way to support her family.  She starts her days early, working Mondays to Sundays, and she tells us that weekends and holidays are especially busy because there are more people around those days.  Her goal for the future is to grow her business and then open a restaurant.  Her sales are increasing by the day but she doesn't have enough working capital to expand further. She is applying to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva for a loan that she will use to buy wholesale supplies of maize, cooking oil and everything else that she needs to oeprate her business.  The investment will allow her to buy what she needs for less than she would otherwise have to pay and avoid ever-rising prices.  The savings will go to her rather than her suppliers.  That's the power of Kiva loans and why this loan will be successful.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies of maize, cooking oil, etc. for her food business.

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 43 years old. She is a mother of three children and resides with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business for more than twenty years, has an extensive experience, and is successful in her career. She is involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. Her husband helps her run the business. She earns approximately $4 per day. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 per day. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Saly is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase a harvester to use for harvesting her crops as well as for rental. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her present house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a harvester to use for harvesting her crops as well as for rental

loans.name: Elsa Nidia

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa Nidia. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león, Es casada, desempeñan el cargo como Directora de educación primaria, tiene 25 años de estar laborando en esta profesión, cuenta con un hijo a su cargo.  

La clienta cuanta con su propia vivienda donde la ha estado mejorando con créditos otorgado con Ceprodel donde este es el Cuarto crédito para la misma actividad, ya que la clienta ha visto cambio en su vida familiar. 
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de Cemento, Arena y Zinc con el fin de darle mejores condiciones a su vivienda y a la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa Nidia lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón in the Department of León. She is married and works as a director of an elementary school, a position she has held for 25 years. Elsa has one dependent child.

She says that her home is in need of improvements, so the loans provided by CEPRODEL will be able to take care of that need. This is the fourth loan she has received for this purpose. Elsa wants to transform her family's life.

This loan will be used to buy cement, sand, and zinc so that she can provide better conditions at home for her and her family to enjoy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mart

texts.en:
Mart is 59 years old and lives with his wife in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his five children all live separately. He started his dairy in 2006 which was right after his retirement. He sells organic dairy products such as milk, curds, etc. Also, he sells eggs. Now he owns eight cows, including calves, and 22 chickens. He is very concerned about their food. He never feeds them with chemicals, which is why his reputation around the neighborhood is high. 

His farm produces a lot of junk which takes a lot of effort to clean. If he buys the necessary equipment, his work will be faster. Therefore, he's requesting 3,000,000 Tugrik (MNT) to buy the necessary equipment to clean his breed of cows.

loans.use: To buy the necessary equipment to clean his breed of cows

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: This is 35-year-old Emmanuel.  He is married.  In 2005, Emmanuel established his ready-made clothing and watches business. The business started to enable him be self reliant. Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from his business. Emmanuel has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional watches and clothing for his business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for more clothing and watches.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma of Caniangan, Tangub City, Philippines, has been cultivating bananas for more than ten years and earns 3,000 PHP per month. She’s 38 years old now and continues to hang on with her livelihood in order to provide an adequate life for her three children. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In order to enhance her business, she is borrowing 6,400 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Gemma hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta is 40 years old and married. She has three children. She is from Pantaon, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Calixta used her last loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell. Her business has grown up and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan for her farm to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She hopes to be able to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma, se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como tortas, tacos y enchiladas, vive con su esposo y dos hijos, ella aprendió el negocio por cuenta propia, esforzándose para encontrar las formas para trabajar, tiene dos años y medio en el negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos para el negocio, como carnes, aceite, tomates, cebollas, papel de empaque y condimentos, para tener lo necesario y seguir en la producción, todo con el objeto de hacer más productivo el negocio y generar más impuestos.
La aspiración de Norma es crecer en el negocio, surtirlo de buenos platillos, para que sea mas rentable.
texts.en:
Norma sells fast food such as sandwiches, tacos, and enchiladas. She lives with her husband and two children. She learned how to start a business on her own by finding ways to work. She has been in the fast food business for 2 years.
At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy products such as meat, oil, tomatoes, onions, packaging paper, and condiments to continue preparing fast food and make her business more profitable.
Norma’s goal is to grow her business and offer many delicious meals to increase profits.

loans.use: buy meat, oil, tomatoes, onions, packaging paper, and condiments

loans.name: Jeobany Antonio

texts.es:
Jeobany, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 10, 7 y 3 años de edad, la vivienda es familiar, tiene dos años de estar realizando el negocio, compra al por mayor y lo distribuye a domicilio.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y frijoles, para abastecer el inventario, y poder continuar distribuyendo a los clientes, este préstamo le dará la oportunidad económica para que Jeovany se mantenga brindando un buen servicio a los clientes. 
La aspiración de él es mantenerse activo con el negocio, poder seguir proveyendo para su familia todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Jeobany sells basic grains, lives with his wife, and 3 children who’s ages range from 10, 7, and 3. He has been working in this business for 2 years. He buys wholesale and sells at retail prices.
He is requesting the loan to buy corn and beans, to stock up his store, and continue selling to clients. This loan will give him the opportunity to continue offering his clients great service.
His goal is to continue being active with his job to provide his family with all they need in life.

loans.use: buy corn and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: fertilizer, herbicides, and seeds

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es: La señora María es una pequeña comerciante que produce y vende tortillas suaves y tostadas, un producto alimenticio de gran demanda en nuestra zona, su negocio lo tiene desde hace 26 años, actividad que lo aprendió desde muy joven y del cual ha podido sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación a sus hijos, según comentarios de doña Maria su casa la tiene gracias a préstamos que ha obtenido y a las ganancias de su negocio, el préstamo que le otorgo ceprodel fue invertido directamente en su actividad económica.
texts.en: Sr. Maria operates a small business making and selling tortilllas, a product much in demand in these parts.  She started her business 26 years ago, a business that was easy for her because she has been making tortillas since she was just a girl.  The business has been difficult at times but her commitment to hard work has paid off because she's made enough to support her children.  She tells us that she is very grateful for the loans she has received.  She will invest the Ceprodel loan directly in her business.

loans.use: to buy maize and firewood for her food business.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo a sus 22 años es un emprendedor, con poderosos deseo de surgir;   que desde ya genera oportunidades de empleo para otros, mediante su negocio de venta de sanduches especiales y en todos los tamaños y combinaciones. Antes de iniciar su aventura de negocios, Leonardo trabajó en una pizzería, lugar donde aprendió a trabajar las comidas rápidas especialmente las derivadas de la harina de trigo. Desde aquí apropió toda su experiencia, que convirtiera posteriormente en su propia microempresa, donde funciona con un empleado y muchos compradores y un importante número de potenciales clientes, a los que también planea llegar, con su vocación de servicio y la precisión, higiene y buen gusto, con que prepara todos los alimentos que vende. Su meta mas adelante, es tener un nuevo punto de ventas, para continuar su camino a la prosperidad, pero su gran desafío, es no tener aun el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr alcanzar sus propósitos. Hoy  está aplicando a un credikiva en  la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como carnes, pollo, lomo de cerdo, piña, salchicha, queso, refrescos con los cuales se abre a las posibilidades de ofrecer asados y otros productos, por que  su clientela ha preguntado y el muy juiciosamente ha tomado nota, para complacerlos y continuar fidelizándolos, impulsando así, el  éxito de esta inversión de su credikiva, con la cual poco a poco alcanzará muy seguramente sus metas futuras.
texts.en:
Leonardo, at age 22, is an entrepreneur with a powerful desire to succeed and he now provides employment to others through his sandwich specials in all sizes and combinations.  Before beginning his business adventure, Leonardo worked in a pizzeria, where he learned to work with fast food, especially those made from wheat flour.  This is where he got all of his experience, which he later converted into his own small business, where he works with an employee and many buyers and a significant number of potential clients.  He plans to win them over with his vocation for service, precision, cleanliness, and good taste in the foods he sells.  His future goal is to have a new point of sale to continue on his path to prosperity, but his greatest challenge is not having enough working capital to reach his potential.

He has applied for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy supplies and ingredients such as meats, chicken, pork loin, pineapple, sausages, cheese, and soft drinks that will open up the possibility of him offering grilled meats and other products that his customers have requested and he has judiciously taken note of to please them and keep them loyal.  His success will be his Kiva loan, with which he will surely, little by little, reach his goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora  Sonia del Carmen, Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león, es casada, cuenta con dos hijos a su cargo,  trabaja actualmente como Enfermera, donde tiene 22 años de laborar en esta profesión, se presentó a Ceprodel por segunda vez con la finalidad de mejorar su vivienda, ya que es de su conocimiento que Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de actividad. 

Para Ella está solicitando crédito, para la compra de Cemento, Arena Y Ladrillo Para Mejorar Las condiciones de su Vivienda Permitiéndole vivir en mejores condiciones con su  familia.  Es por ello que le agradece a la institución el apoyo que le puedan brindar.
texts.en:
Sonia del Carmen lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa del Peñón, in the department of León. She is married and has two children in her care. Currently she is working as a nurse, and she has 22 years of experience in this profession. She came to Ceprodel for a second time with the goal of improving her home, since she knew that Ceprodel supports this type of activity.

She is asking for a loan to buy cement, sand, and bricks to improve the conditions of her home, which will allow her to live in better conditions with her family. This is why she is grateful to the institution for the support they are able to offer her.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bricks.

loans.name: Jussel Anne

texts.en: Jussel Anne is married, 28 years old, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her two kids. Jussel Anne operates a sari-sari store to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 11,700 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her store. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Jussel Anne will use her income to support her three kids in their studies until they finish college, and also in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her store.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married with four children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Emelia is a farmer who cultivates bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 27 years, and every month she earns 5,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 1,600 PHP to purchase fertilizer.

Emelia has been a member of GDMPC for four years. Her hope for the future is to allow her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohamed B.

texts.en: This is 36-year-old Mohamed. He is married, and has 3 children aged 1, 4 and 9 years. In 2008, Mohamed established his used bicycle business. He began his business after dropping out of school for lack of fees and to be self reliant. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,982,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mohamed requires a loan in order to develop the business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL. In the future, Mohamed plans to be able to expand to a permanent store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for bicycles

loans.name: Elyor

texts.ru: Элёр честный и воспитанный молодой семьянин, ему 21 лет. Он старается содержать свою семью в хороших условиях, чтобы в доме был уют и комфорт. Его любящая жена всегда поддерживает его в трудностях. Три года назад Элёр начал заниматься предоставлением услуги столовой, в основном жарит рыбу и приготавливает шашлыки. Приготавливает вкусно, и всегда из свежих продуктов. Жена помогает в ведении бизнеса. Элёр хотел бы получить займ для покупки рыбы и топчанов для столовой.
texts.en: Elyor is an honest and disciplined young family man. He is 21 years old. Elyor wants to provide a comfortable life for his young family and his loving wife supports him with all of his difficulties. Three years ago Elyor has opened a cafe where he offers fried fish and kebab. His food is delicious and he always uses fresh ingredients. His wife helps him in the cafe. Elyor wants to take out this loan to purchase fish and couches for his cafe.

loans.use: To buy fish for cooking and couches for his café

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: En pleno centro de Barranquilla, Eliana de 37 años, madre de 4 hijos en las edades de 9 a 15 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar persistentemente en su propio negocio, vendiendo en mayor volumen frutas y verduras tropicales y bien frescas, como tomate, cebolla, zanahoria, pepino, remolacha, papa, lulo, melón maracuyá y todas las que produzca la cosecha de cada temporada.  Esta condición ha hecho que gane todos los días mucha mas clientela y por eso también ha logrado tener dos locales o puntos de ventas, uno de los cuales atiende su cónyuge; con estos negocios ambos,  han logrado generar ingresos, para el sostenimiento de su hogar y especialmente para pagar a educación de sus hijos. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa, pues actualmente su familia habita en casa de su abuela materna y su mayor sueño es tener su vivienda.  Su esmero en trabajar todos los días, se hace muy evidente pues todo lo que gana lo invierte en generar ingresos; últimamente está vendiendo queso y suero, aprovechando que en sus tres años como comerciante, conoce mucho el mercado público donde está ubicada;  por eso da crédito a personas que ya conoce y que lo compran para vender estos productos lácteos más adelante y para el consumo de sus familias; con este último negocio, genera ingresos adicionales, con los que aumenta cada vez mas el bienestar de su familia y por eso ante la demanda no solo de las frutas, las verduras sino también de su queso y suero, su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente, para responder a su clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprara’ al por mayor, frutas, verduras, con los cuales aumentará su capital de trabajo y será suficiente para invertir con las utilidades que le produzca su inversión credikiva, en queso y suero; la que promete ser exitosa, porque la hace en el marco de la demanda del mercado, conoce bien las necesidades de su  clientela  y con ella genera una rentabilidad no menor del 29 % y le proporciona  un margen de contribución del 57%.
texts.en:
Eliana, age 37, has four children from the ages of 9 to 15.  She works persistently in her own business in the heart of Barranquilla.  She sells very fresh tropical fruits and vegetables in large volume.  She sells things like tomatoes, onions, carrots, cucumbers, beets, potatoes, 'lulo' (a native fruit), melon, passion fruit, and everything that is produced in the harvest of each season.

Because of this she wins over a lot more customers every day.  Also, she has managed to have two points of sales.  Her husband tends to one of them.  With these businesses they have both managed to generate income to support her household and especially to pay for her children’s education.

Her goal for later on is to have her own house.  Her family currently lives with her maternal grandmother.  Her greatest dream is to have a house.  She works carefully every day, and that makes it very evident that everything she earns is invested in generating income.  Lately she has been selling cheese and whey, taking advantage of her three years as a merchant.  She knows a lot about the public market where she is.  That is why she gives credit to people she knows so that they can buy these dairy products to later sell or use for their family’s consumption.

With this last business she generates additional income, which increases her family’s well-being every day.  However, she has insufficient working capital to meet her customers’ demand for fruit, vegetables, cheese, and whey.

That is the reason why she turns to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables.  This will increase her working capital, and there will be enough profits produced by her Kiva loan to invest in cheese and whey.    This promises to be successful because she does it within the framework of the market demand.  She knows her customers’ needs very well .  She generates a profitability of no less than 29% and a contribution margin of 57%.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат жительница района Шахритус. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Карамат занимается животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Karamat lives in Shahrituz region. She is 32 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works abroad. Karamat herself raises cattle for sale. She has had her livestock business for four years. Karamat need this loan to purchase more calves.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Homidjon

texts.ru: Хомидчон женат и на воспитании имеет четверых детей. Он трудолюбивый человек, который старается улучшить свое благосостояние семьи, только Хомидчон работает, жена занимается домохозяйством. Хомидчон имеет торговую точку на местном рынке и там занимается купле- продажей запчастей. Хомидчон запрашивает займ для покупки товара с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вашу помощь и щедрость.
texts.en: Homidjon is married and a father of four children. He is a hardworking man who always tries to improve his family's living conditions and is the sole provider in the family while his wife is a home maker. Homidjon has a stall at the local market where he sells spare parts. He is requesting this loan to purchase a wholesale lot of spare parts. Homidjon hopes for your help and generosity.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей, старшему 6 лет, а младшему 2 года. Умед работает на рынке более 6 лет сборщиком налогов. За последнее 1,5 года он занимается предоставлением услуг автомойки. Его автомойка находится недалеко от рынка. Его жена занимается домохозяйством и присматривает за детьми. Умед хотел бы получить займ для покупки аппарата для мытья автомашин, пылесос и для ремонта здания автомойки. Умед надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Umed is a hardworking and kind man, he is married and is raising two children. Umed's wife is a home maker and takes care of their children. His oldest is six years old and his youngest is only two. Umed has been working as a tax collector at the local market for six years. For the last one and a half years he also started a car washing business, which is located near the market.  Umed wants to take out this loan to purchase another car-washing apparatus, as well as a vacuum and will also refurbish the building where his business is located. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase of car-washing apparatus

loans.name: Nora Mercedes

texts.es: Nora ofreció una nueva oferta de productos, debutar en los eventos que la contrataron y esto fue gracias a que su credikiva le alcanzó para comprar materias primas e insumos y se las ingenió para que los invitados de primeras comuniones, fiestas de quince años, grados etc, degustaran las delicias con que los prepara sus productos. En la actualidad está muy entusiasmada y aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará materias primas para hacer refrigerios y surtir los colegios con los que tiene un contrato y debe cumplirlo efectivamente, para ganar un poco mas de dinero y aumentar su capital de trabajo. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos por la oportunidad de ayuda que me brindaron para poder sostener mi casa”.
texts.en: Nora offered some new products that she debuted at events that people hired her for.  This was thanks to her Kiva loan, which allowed her to buy raw materials and supplies.  She managed to have the guests at first communions, 15th birthday celebrations, graduations, etc. try out the delicacies she made with her products.  Now she is very enthusiastic and is applying for a new Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy more raw materials and supplies to make snacks, and to stock up for the schools with which she has a contract which she must fulfill.  This way she can earn a bit more money and increase her working capital.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following "Thank you for this opportunity and the help you are providing me so that I can support my household."

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make snacks

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is from Capucao, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old and married with five children.

To make a living, Julieta cultivates corn land and bananas. Julieta has been in her business for 15 years and earns 11,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Julieta joined Kiva partner GDMPC. Julieta is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is from Caniangan, Ozamis City. She is 55 years old. Jovita is a widow and has one child.

To make a living, she manages a business planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for sale. She has been engaged in her business for 30 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.
